e

e 1

letter. (gram) letter e; 7th letter of the alphabet; gutturo-palatal vowel ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter e; 7th letter of the alphabet; gutturo-palatal vowel
Sanskrit e

Example

a kavagga hā kaṇṭhajā, i cavagga yā tālujā, u pavaggā oṭṭhajā, ṭavagga ra ḷā muddhajā, tavagga la sā dantajā, e kaṇṭhatālujo, o kaṇṭh'oṭṭhajo, vo dant'oṭṭhajo.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
e 2

letter. (gram) vuddhi form of the letters i and ī ✓

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) vuddhi form of the letters i and ī
Sanskrit e

Examples

514, 491. e aya.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 514

te o e'icc'ete āva āy'ādese pāpuṇanti kārite. lāveti, nāyeti. yogavibhāgena aññasmim'pi ekārassa āy'ādeso hoti. gāyati, gāyanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 515
eka 1

card. one (1) ✓

Grammar card, masc fem nt sg
Meaning one (1)
Antonym aneka
Sanskrit eka

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso, evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

yo ca gāthā sataṃ bhāse,
anatthapadasaṃhitā,
ekaṃ dhammapadaṃ seyyo,
yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

DHP 102 sahassavaggo
eka 2

adj. a; a certain; a single ✓

Grammar adj, used as indefinite article
Meaning a; a certain; a single
Antonym aneka
Notes used as an indefinite article
Sanskrit eka

Examples

yo ca vassasataṃ jantu,
aggiṃ paricare vane,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ,
muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo,
yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

DHP 107 sahassavaggo

atīte kira kassapasammāsambuddhakāle gāmavāsī eko kuṭumbiko ekassa therassa vihāraṃ katvā taṃ tattha viharantaṃ catūhi paccayehi upaṭṭhahi

DHPa 1.5.11 jambukatthera vatthu
eka 3

adj. alone; single; solitary ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning alone; single; solitary
Antonym aneka
Synonym ekaka, ekākiya, kevala
Sanskrit eka

Examples

supupphit'aggaṃ upagamma bhikkhuni,
ekā tuvaṃ tiṭṭhasi sālamūle,
na c'atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,
bāle na tvaṃ bhāyasi dhuttakānan'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ

so eko gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisati eko paṭikkamati eko raho nisīdati eko caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhāti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ
eka 4

adj. only ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning only
Antonym aneka
Sanskrit eka

Examples

tesam'assa ekaputtako piyo manāpo

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ, āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu, mānasam'bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
eka 5

adj. same; one and the same ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning same; one and the same
Sanskrit eka

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ. tatth'āyaṃ samayo, satthagamanīyo hoti maggo, sāsaṅkasammato, sappaṭibhayo, ayaṃ tattha samayo.

VIN PAT PC 27 saṃvidhānasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 28 nāvābhiruhanasikkhāpadaṃ
eka 6

nt. one thing; single thing [eka] ✗
eka 7

ind. once ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning once
Synonym sakiṃ
Sanskrit eka

Example

ekajaṃ vā dvijaṃ vā'pi,
yo'dha pāṇaṃ vihiṃsati,
yassa pāṇe dayā n'atthi,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
ekausabhagāmī

adj. going one usabha; travelling 640 metres [eka + usabha + gāmī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning going one usabha; travelling 640 metres
Construction eka + usabha + gāmī
ekaka 1

adj. alone; solitary [eka + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from eka
Meaning alone; solitary
Construction eka + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym eka, ekākiya
Sanskrit ekaka

Examples

gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 42 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ

devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati,
ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi,
tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato,
n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.

TH 155 sambulakaccānattheragāthā
ekaka 2

nt. group of one [eka + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from eka
Meaning group of one
Construction eka + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit ekaka

Example

ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā, nava navakā, dasa dasakā'ti, satam'pi mayaṃ, bho gotama, gaṇāpema, bhiyyo'pi gaṇāpema.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
ekakaṅkhā

fem. single doubt; one uncertainty [eka + kaṅkhā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning single doubt; one uncertainty
Construction eka + kaṅkhā
ekakanipāta 1

masc. Book 1 of the Itivuttaka; Book of Ones ✗
ekakanipāta 2

masc. Chapter 1 of the Theragāthā (TH1-120) ✗
ekakanipāta 3

masc. Chapter 1 of the Therīgāthā (THI1-18) ✗
ekakanipāta 4

masc. Chapter 1 of the Jātaka ✗
ekakanipātapāḷi

fem. Book 1 of the Aṅguttara Nikāya; Book of Ones ✗
ekakappa

masc. one aeon [eka + kappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one aeon
Construction eka + kappa
Compound digu (eko + kappo)
Sanskrit eka + kalpa

Examples

sara catur'odadhī,
upanīte assuthaññarudhiramhi,
sara ekakappam'aṭṭhīnaṃ,
sañcayaṃ vipulena samaṃ.

THI 73 sumedhātherīgāthā

aparimeyyito kappe,
caturo āsuṃ vināyakā,
taṇhaṅkaro medhaṅkaro,
atho'pi saraṇaṅkaro,
dīpaṅkaro ca sambuddho,
ekakappamhi te jinā.

BV 28 buddha pakiṇṇaka kaṇḍaṃ
ekakamma

nt. same legal action; performing legal procedures together [eka + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning same legal action; performing legal procedures together
Construction eka + kamma
Compound digu (ekaṃ + kammaṃ)
Commentary (VINa) catubbidham'pi saṅghakammaṃ sīmāparicchinnehi pakatattehi bhikkhūhi ekato kattabbattā ekakammaṃ nāma
Sanskrit ekakarman

Example

asaṃvāso'ti saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ek'uddeso samasikkhatā, eso saṃvāso nāma. so tena saddhiṃ n'atthi. tena vuccati, asaṃvāso'ti.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro
ekakiya

adj. alone; solitary ✗
ekakuṭika

adj. with one hut; with one house [eka + kuṭi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with one hut; with one house
Construction eka + kuṭi + ka
ekakuṭi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VINa) tattha yasmiṃ gāme ekā eva kuṭi, ekaṃ gehaṃ seyyathā'pi malayajanapade, ayaṃ ekakuṭiko gāmo nāma. etena nayena apare'pi veditabbā.
Sanskrit eka + kuṭi +

Example

gāmo nāma ekakuṭiko'pi gāmo, dvikuṭiko'pi gāmo, tikuṭiko'pi gāmo, catukuṭiko'pi gāmo, samanusso'pi gāmo, amanusso'pi gāmo, parikkhitto'pi gāmo, aparikkhitto'pi gāmo, gonisādiniviṭṭho'pi gāmo, yo'pi sattho atirekacatumāsaniviṭṭho so'pi vuccati gāmo.

ekagārika 1

nt. attacking and robbing isolated houses ✗
ekagārika 2

nt. taking alms only from one house ✗
ekaguṇa

adj. one time; once [eka + guṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning one time; once
Construction eka + guṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + guṇa)
Sanskrit eka + guṇa

Example

ucc'āvacā hi paṭipadā,
samaṇena pakāsitā,
na pāraṃ diguṇaṃ yanti,
na'y'idaṃ ekaguṇaṃ mutaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
ekaguṇaṃ

ind. once ✗
ekagga 1

adj. unified; collected; lit. one place [eka + agga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning unified; collected; lit. one place
Construction eka + agga
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + agga)
Sanskrit eka + āgāra

Examples

āraddhaṃ kho pana me brāhmaṇa vīriyaṃ ahosi asallīnaṃ upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā passaddho kāyo asāraddho samāhitaṃ cittaṃ ekaggaṃ

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

thaddhavisamabhūmibhāgasmiñ'hi caṅkame caṅkamantassa pādā rujjanti, phoṭā uṭṭhahanti, cittaṃ ekaggaṃ na labhati, kammaṭṭhānaṃ vipajjati.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
ekagga 2

nt. unification; oneness; lit. one place [eka + agga] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning unification; oneness; lit. one place
Construction eka + agga
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + agga)
Synonym ekaggatā
Sanskrit eka + āgāra
ekaggacitta

adj. with a unified mind; with a collected mind; lit. one place mind [ekagga + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a unified mind; with a collected mind; lit. one place mind
Construction ekagga + citta
Compound kammadhāraya (ekagga + citta)
Antonym vibbhantacitta, anekaggacitta
Sanskrit eka + āgāra + citta

Examples

ye pana te kulaputtā ... āraddhavīriyā pahit'attā upaṭṭhitassatino sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

so tāya samādhisampadāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti, aham'asmi samāhito ekaggacitto, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū asamāhitā vibbhantacittā'ti.

MN 29 mahāsāropamasuttaṃ
ekaggatā

fem. unification; oneness; lit. one place state [eka + agga + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from ekagga
Meaning unification; oneness; lit. one place state
Construction eka + agga + tā
ekagga + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Synonym ekagga
Sanskrit ekāyanagata, ekāgratā (bsk)

Examples

saddhassa hi, bhante, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ vossagg'ārammaṇaṃ karitvā labhissati samādhiṃ, labhissati cittassa ek'aggataṃ.

SN 48.50 āpaṇasuttaṃ

yā kho, āvuso visākha, cittassa ekaggatā ayaṃ samādhi, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā samādhinimittā, cattāro sammappadhānā samādhiparikkhārā.

MN 44 cūḷavedallasuttaṃ
ekagghana

adj. solid; dense; lit. one mass [eka + ghana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning solid; dense; lit. one mass
Construction eka + ghana
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + ghana)
Synonym appita, ghana
Variant ekaghana
Sanskrit eka + ghana

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhante, selo pabbato acchiddo asusiro ekagghano. atha puratthimāya ce'pi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi n'eva naṃ saṅkampeyya na sampakampeyya na sampavedheyya

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ

selo yathā ekagghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ rūpā rasā saddā,
gandhā phassā ca kevalā,
iṭṭhā dhammā aniṭṭhā ca,
nappavedhenti tādino.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
ekaghana

adj. solid; dense; lit. one mass [eka + ghana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning solid; dense; lit. one mass
Construction eka + ghana
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + ghana)
Synonym appita, ghana
Variant ekagghana
Sanskrit eka + ghana

Example

selo yathā ekaghano,
vātena na samīrati,
evaṃ nindāpasaṃsāsu,
na samiñjanti paṇḍitā.

DHP 81 paṇḍitavaggo
ekaṅga

nt. one factor; single quality; lit. one part [eka + aṅga] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one factor; single quality; lit. one part
Construction eka + aṅga
Compound digu (ekaṃ + aṅgaṃ)
Sanskrit eka + aṅga

Example

sekhassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appattamānasassa anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānassa viharato ajjhattikaṃ aṅgan'ti karitvā n'āññaṃ ek'aṅgam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bah'ūpakāraṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikāro.

ITI 16 paṭhamasekhasuttaṃ
ekaṅgadassī

adj. seeing only one aspect; viewing from one angle; lit. seeing one part [ekaṅga + dassī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning seeing only one aspect; viewing from one angle; lit. seeing one part
Construction ekaṅga + dassī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ekaṅgaṃ + dassī)
Commentary (UDa) janā ek'aṅgadassino yath'eva jaccandhajanā hatthissa ek'ek'aṅgadassino yaṃ yaṃ attanā phusitvā ñātaṃ, taṃ tad'eva hatthī'ti gahetvā aññam'aññaṃ viggayha vivadiṃsu, evaṃsampadam'idan'ti attho. ivasaddo c'ettha luttaniddiṭṭho'ti veditabbo. (THa) ek'aṅgadassī dummedho'ti evaṃ anekaliṅge anekalakkhaṇe atthe yo tattha ek'aṅgadassī aputhupaññatāya ekaliṅgamattaṃ ekalakkhaṇamattañ'ca disvā attanā diṭṭham'eva idam'eva saccan'ti abhinivissa mogham'aññan'ti itaraṃ paṭikkhipati
Sanskrit eka + aṅga + darśin

Example

imesu kira sajjanti,
eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā,
viggayha naṃ vivadanti,
janā ek'aṅgadassino'ti.

UD 54 paṭhamanānātitthiyasuttaṃ
ekaṅgahīna

adj. deficient in one respect; lacking one attribute ✗
ekacakkhu

adj. one-eyed; half-sighted; having a single eye [eka + cakkhu] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning one-eyed; half-sighted; having a single eye
Construction eka + cakkhu
Commentary (MNt) paññācakkhunā diṭṭhadhammikassa samparāyikassa ca atthassa adassanato andho, diṭṭhadhammikass'eva dassanato ekacakkhu, dvinnam'pi dassanato dvicakkhu, veditabbo.
ekacattālīsama

ordin. forty-first (41st) ✗
ekacattālīsā

card. forty one (41) [eka + cattālīsā] ✓

Grammar card, fem sg, comp
Meaning forty one (41)
Construction eka + cattālīsā
Compound dvanda (eka ca cattālīsā ca)
Sanskrit ekacatvāriṃśat

Example

2. akkharā'p'ādayo ekacattālīsaṃ.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
ekacara

adj. solitary; living alone; wandering alone [eka + cara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning solitary; living alone; wandering alone
Construction eka + cara
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + cara)
Synonym ekacārī
Variant ekacāra
Commentary (SNa) sīhaṃ'v'ekacaraṃ nāgan'ti ekacaraṃ sīhaṃ viya, ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ viya. gaṇavāsino hi pamattā honti, ekacarā appamattā, tasmā ekacarāva gahitā'ti.
Sanskrit ekacara

Examples

dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacaraṃ,
asarīraṃ guh'āsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti,
mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

DHP 37 cittavaggo

eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ,
app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ,
kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma,
kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti

SN 1.30 eṇijaṅghasuttaṃ
ekacariya

nt. living alone; solitude; being single; lit. walking alone [eka + cariya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning living alone; solitude; being single; lit. walking alone
Construction eka + cariya
Compound digu (ekā + cariyā)
Variant ekaccariya
Sanskrit ekacara

Examples

carañ'ce n'ādhigaccheyya,
seyyaṃ sadisam'attano,
ekacariyaṃ daḷhaṃ kayirā,
n'atthi bāle sahāyatā.

DHP 61 bālavaggo

paṇḍito'ti samaññāto,
ekacariyaṃ adhiṭṭhito,
athā'pi methune yutto,
mando'va parikissati.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7
ekacariyā

fem. going about or living alone, solitariness; solitary life ✗
ekacāra

adj. solitary; living alone; wandering alone [eka + cāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning solitary; living alone; wandering alone
Construction eka + cāra
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + cāra)
Synonym ekacārī
Variant ekacara
Commentary (DHPa) uppattikāle ek'ekam'eva cittaṃ uppajjati, tasmiṃ niruddhe puna ek'ekam'eva uppajjatī'ti ekacaraṃ nāma jātaṃ.
Sanskrit eka + cāra

Example

dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacāraṃ,
asarīraṃ guh'āsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti,
mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

DHP3 cittavaggo
ekacārī

adj. solitary; living alone; wandering alone [eka + cārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning solitary; living alone; wandering alone
Construction eka + cārī
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + cārī)
Synonym ekacara, ekacāra
Notes ekacāri is nt nom sg describing "citttaṃ"
Sanskrit ekacārin

Example

arūpa dūraṅ'gama ekacāri,
na te karissaṃ vacanaṃ idāni'haṃ,
dukkhā hi kāmā kaṭukā mahabbhayā,
nibbānam'ev'ābhimano carissaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ekacīvara

adj. wearing one robe; with an under-robe [eka + cīvara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wearing one robe; with an under-robe
Construction eka + cīvara
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + cīvara)
Sanskrit eka + cīvara

Examples

tap'ode gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubb'āpayamāno.

SN 1.20 samiddhisuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ yena pubbakoṭṭhako ten'upasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ. pubbakoṭṭhake gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubb'āpayamāno.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
ekacca 1

pron. certain; one of [eka + tya] ✓

Grammar pron, from eka
Meaning certain; one of
Construction eka + tya
Derivative taddhita (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Notes (PED) lit. ‘one-like'
Sanskrit ekatya

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu bhikkhusaṅghaṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti, aham'pi bhikkhu, aham'pi bhikkhū'ti.

AN 3.83 gadrabhasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appamattakam'pi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tam'enaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
ekacca 2

pron. some; a few [eka + tya] ✓

Grammar pron, from eka
Meaning some; a few
Construction eka + tya
Derivative taddhita (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Synonym appekacca
Sanskrit ekatya

Examples

katamā ca, sāriputta, opapātikā yoni? devā, nerayikā, ekacce ca manussā, ekacce ca vinipātikā, ayaṃ vuccati, sāriputta, opapātikā yoni.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

ye'me, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā, bahujanassa ... sabb'ete sakāya paṭiññāya abbhaññaṃsu sabb'eva n'ābbhaññaṃsu, udāhu ekacce abbhaññaṃsu ekacce n'ābbhaññaṃsū'ti?

MN 30 cūḷasāropamasuttaṃ
ekacca 3

adj. in part; partial [eka + tya] ~

Grammar adj, from eka
Meaning in part; partial
Construction eka + tya
Derivative taddhita (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit ekatya
ekaccaasassatika

adj. believing in the non-eternality of some things; professing partial non-eternalism [ekacca + asassatika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning believing in the non-eternality of some things; professing partial non-eternalism
Construction ekacca + asassatika
Antonym ekaccasassatika
ekaccasassatavāda

masc. doctrine of partial eternalism ✗
ekaccasassatika

adj. believing in the eternality of some things; professing partial eternalism [ekacca + sassatika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning believing in the eternality of some things; professing partial eternalism
Construction ekacca + sassatika
Antonym ekaccaasassatika
Commentary (DNa) ekaccasassatikā'ti ekaccasassatavādā. te duvidhā honti, satt'ekaccasassatikā, saṅkhār'ekaccasassatikā'ti. duvidhā'pi idha gahitā'y'eva.
Sanskrit ekatyaśāśvatika (bsk)
ekaccika

adj. single, of a single thickness ✗
ekacciya

adj. certain; some [eka + tya + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ekacca
Meaning certain; some
Construction eka + tya + iya
ekacca + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Sanskrit ekatiya

Example

saccaṃ kir'evam'āhaṃsu,
narā ekacciyā idha,
kaṭṭhaṃ niplavitaṃ seyyo,
na tv'ev'ekacciyo naro'ti.

JA 73 saccaṃkira jātakaṃ
ekacchanne

ind. under the same roof; in the same room; lit. in one covered [eka + channa + e] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, loc sg of ekacchanna
Meaning under the same roof; in the same room; lit. in one covered
Construction eka + channa + e
ekacchanna + e
Sanskrit eka + channa

Example

saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyyā'ti ekacchanne ukkhittake nipanne bhikkhu nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa. bhikkhu nipanne ukkhittako nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa. ubho vā nipajjanti, āpatti pācittiyassa.

ekachiggala

adj. having one hole ✗

adj. having one hole ✗

ekajaṃ vā dvijaṃ vā'pi,

yassa pāṇe dayā n'atthi,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso yaṃ imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ tacchetvā ekajjhaṃ saṃhareyya, ekajjhaṃ saṃharitvā sūlaṃ kareyya

SN 56.36 pāṇasuttaṃ
ekañca

sandhi. but one; but a single [eka + aṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning but one; but a single
Construction eka + aṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit ekam + ca

Examples

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

DHP 103 sahassavaggo

nānā hi kho no, bhante, kāyā ekañ'ca pana maññe cittan'ti

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
ekaññeva

sandhi. just one; only one; merely a single [ekaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning just one; only one; merely a single
Construction ekaṃ + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit ekam + eva

Examples

ekaññ'eva nu kho, bhante, bhagavā saññ'aggaṃ paññapeti, udāhu puthū'pi saññ'agge paññapetī'ti? ekam'pi kho ahaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, saññ'aggaṃ paññapemi, puthū'pi saññ'agge paññapemī'ti.

DN 9.3 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā

assadamakena, bhikkhave, assadammo sārito ekaññ'eva disaṃ dhāvati, puratthimaṃ vā pacchimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā dakkhiṇaṃ vā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ekañhi

sandhi. just one; only one [ekaṃ + hi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning just one; only one
Construction ekaṃ + hi
Sanskrit eka + hi

Example

ekañ'hi saccaṃ na dutīyam'atthi,
yasmiṃ pajā no vivade pajānaṃ,
nānā te saccāni sayaṃ thunanti,
tasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

SN 55.23 godhasakkasuttaṃ

na ukkhittakāya antaraghare gantabbaṃ. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā ukkhipitvā antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

ayaṃ pan'ettha saṅkhepo, bhagavato kira bhikkhusaṅghassa ca pañcannaṃ mahānadīnaṃ mah'oghasadise lābhasakkāre uppanne hatalābhasakkārā aññatitthiyā sūriy'uggamanakāle khajjopanakā viya nippabhā hutvā ekato sannipatitvā mantayiṃsu.

DHPa 2.22.1 sundarī paribbājikā vatthu
ekatoavassuta

adj. one having lust; one being aroused; lit. one flooded [ekato + avassuta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning one having lust; one being aroused; lit. one flooded
Construction ekato + avassuta
Commentary (KVt) ekatoavassute'ti bhikkhuniyā avassave, bhikkhuniyā kāyasaṃsaggarāgena avassutabhāve satī'ti attho. bhikkhuniyā vasen'eva ca ekatoavassutabhāvo gahetabbo.
ekatoupasampanna

adj. ordained in (only) one saṅgha) ✗
ekatoupasampannā

fem. (vinaya) nun ordained by one order; lit. ordained from one side [ekato + upasampanna + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (vinaya) nun ordained by one order; lit. ordained from one side
Construction ekato + upasampanna + ā
ekatoupasampanna + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Commentary (VINa) ekatoupasampannāyā'ti ettha bhikkhunīnaṃ santike ekatoupasampannāya, yo garudhammena ovadati, tassa dukkaṭaṃ. bhikkhūnaṃ santike upasampannāya pana yathāvatthukam'eva.
Sanskrit ekatas + upasaṃpanna

Example

ovadeyyā'ti aṭṭhahi garudhammehi ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa. aññena dhammena ovadati, āpatti dukkaṭassa. ekatoupasampannaṃ ovadati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

nt. solitude; loneliness; lit. one state [eka + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from eka
Meaning solitude; loneliness; lit. one state
Construction eka + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Commentary (MNa) ekatte'ti ekībhāve. kiṃ dasseti? kāyaviveke kate'pi tattha cittaṃ abhiramāpetuṃ dukkaraṃ. dvayaṃdvay'ārāmo hi ayaṃ loko'ti
Sanskrit ekatva

Examples

samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ekattaṃ monam'akkhātaṃ,
eko ce abhiramissasi,
atha bhāhisi dasadisā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

durabhisambhavāni hi kho, bho gotama, araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni, dukkaraṃ pavivekaṃ, durabhiramaṃ ekatte, haranti maññe mano vanāni samādhiṃ alabhamānassa bhikkhuno'ti.

MN 1 mūlapariyāyasuttaṃ

chinda sotaṃ parakkamma, kāme panūda brāhmaṇa.
nappahāya munī kāme, n'ekattam'upapajjati.

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
ekatta 3

nt. deep meditation; immersion; absorption; lit. one state [eka + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from eka
Meaning deep meditation; immersion; absorption; lit. one state
Construction eka + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Commentary (SNa) ekattan'ti jhānaṃ. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, kāme ajahitvā muni jhānaṃ na upapajjati, na paṭilabhatī'ti attho.

Example

chinda sotaṃ parakkamma,

SN 2.8 tāyanasuttaṃ
ekatta 4

adj. single; unified; uniform; unique [eka + tta + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from ekatta
Meaning single; unified; uniform; unique
Construction eka + tta + a
ekatta + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Antonym nānatta
Synonym advaya, ekodi
Commentary (MNa) ekattā ekattasitā'ti catutthajjhān'upekkhā, sā hi divasam'pi ekasmiṃ ārammaṇe uppajjanato ekasabhāvā, tadeva ekaṃ ārammaṇaṃ nissitattā ekattasitā nāma.
Sanskrit ekatva

Examples

evam'etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya disvā y'āyaṃ upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā taṃ abhinivajjetvā, y'āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā yattha sabbaso lok'āmis'ūpādānā aparisesā nirujjhanti tam'ev'ūpekkhaṃ bhāveti.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ

atthi, bhikkhave, upekkhā ākāsānañc'āyatananissitā, atthi viññāṇañc'āyatananissitā, atthi ākiñcaññ'āyatananissitā, atthi n'evasaññān'āsaññ'āyatananissitā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā.

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

atthi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā nān'ātthā c'eva nānābyañjanā ca, atthi ca kho, āvuso, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma ime dhammā ek'atthā, byañjanam'eva nānaṃ.

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning perceiving (someone) as on one sheet and under one cover
Construction ekattharaṇapāvuraṇa + sañña
ekathālaka

masc. one cup; single vessel [eka + thālaka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one cup; single vessel
Construction eka + thālaka
Sanskrit eka + sthāla, sthālaka (bsk)
ekadā 1

ind. one day; sometimes; at some (unspecified) time; lit. one time [eka + dā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from eka
Meaning one day; sometimes; at some (unspecified) time; lit. one time
Construction eka + dā
Derivative taddhita (dā)
Sanskrit ekadā

Examples

ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yen'ekadā dīgharattaṃ sajjhāyakatā'pi mantā nappaṭibhanti, pag'eva asajjhāyakatā?

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

laddhā hi so upādānaṃ,
mahā hutvāna pāvako,
so āsajja ḍahe bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
ekadā 2

ind. at once; immediately; suddenly; lit. one time [eka + dā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from eka
Meaning at once; immediately; suddenly; lit. one time
Construction eka + dā
Derivative taddhita (dā)
Synonym āyatakena
Sanskrit ekadā

Example

ucc'āvacehi vaṇṇehi,
urago carati tejasī,
so āsajja ḍaṃse bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
ekadāsikā

fem. only maid; single maidservant [eka + dāsikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning only maid; single maidservant
Construction eka + dāsikā
Sanskrit eka + dāsikā

Example

kathañ'hi nāma ekadāsikāya divā uṭṭhāsī'ti kupitā anattamanā aggaḷasūciṃ gahetvā sīse pahāraṃ dassati, sīsaṃ vobhindissatī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
ekadivasa

masc. one day [eka + divasa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one day
Construction eka + divasa
Compound digu (ekaṃ + divasaṃ)
Synonym ekāha
Sanskrit eka + divasa

Example

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ yaṃ me tīhi māsehi dātabbaṃ siyā taṃ sabbaṃ ekadivasen'eva dadeyyan'ti

VINa 1.V.15 buddhāciṇṇakathā
ekadivasaṃ

ind. one day [eka + divasa + aṃ] ✓

Meaning one day
Construction eka + divasa + aṃ

Compound digu (ekaṃ + divasaṃ)
Sanskrit eka + divasena + eva

Example

aparaṃ pana ekadivasaṃ uyyānaṃ gacchanto tath'eva devatāhi nimmitaṃ sunivatthaṃ supārutaṃ pabbajitaṃ disvā, ko nām'eso sammā'ti sārathiṃ pucchi.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidāna kathā

ekaddhānamagga

masc. same highway; single main road [eka + addhāna + magga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning same highway; single main road
Construction eka + addhāna + magga
Compound digu (eko + addhānamaggo)
Sanskrit eka + adhvāna + mārga

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 27 saṃvidhānasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ek'addhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya antamaso gām'antaram'pi, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 66 theyyasatthasikkhāpadaṃ
ekadvāra 1

adj. with one gateway; with one entrance [eka + dvāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with one gateway; with one entrance
Construction eka + dvāra
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + dvāra)
Antonym bahudvāra
Commentary (ANa) ekadvāran'ti kasmā āha? bahudvārasmiñ'hi nagare bahūhi paṇḍitadovārikehi bhavitabbaṃ, ekadvāre eko'va vaṭṭati. tathāgatassa ca paññāya añño sadiso n'atthi. tasmā satthu paṇḍitabhāvassa opamm'atthaṃ ekaṃ'y'eva dovārikaṃ dassetuṃ ekadvāran'ti āha.
Sanskrit ekadvāra

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso uttiya, rañño paccantimaṃ nagaraṃ daḷh'uddhāpaṃ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṃ ekadvāraṃ. tatr'assa dovāriko paṇḍito byatto medhāvī aññātānaṃ nivāretā ñātānaṃ pavesetā.

AN 10.95 uttiyasuttaṃ

vadhaṃ rocesi gotamā'ti.

SN 1.71 chetvāsuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ lahuparivattaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ cittaṃ. yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhikkhave, upamā'pi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṃ cittan'ti.

ekanāḷika

adj. (sutta) which discusses the meaning of each word individually; lit. one stem; one stalk [eka + nāḷika] ~

Grammar adj, comp

Construction eka + nāḷika
Commentary (ANa) tattha pāḷiṃ vatvā ekekassa padassa atthakathanaṃ ekanāḷikā nāma.
Notes three kinds of discourses 1. ekanāḷika, 2. caturassa, 3. nisinnavattika

Compound digu (eko + nikāyo)
Sanskrit eka + nikāya

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyam'pi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā, te'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citten'eva cittitā, tehi'pi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññ'eva cittataraṃ.

ITI 14 avijjānīvaraṇasuttaṃ
ekanta 1

adj. absolute; total; perfect; complete; exclusive; lit. with one side [eka + anta] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, comp
Meaning absolute; total; perfect; complete; exclusive; lit. with one side
Construction eka + anta
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + anta)
Synonym accanta, ekantagata, ekantigata, kevala, paripuṇṇa
Sanskrit ekānta

Examples

sambādho ghar'āvāso rajāpatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā. na'y'idaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ek'antaparipuṇṇaṃ ek'antaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
ekanta 2

ind. only; merely; just; lit. one side [eka + anta] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, in comps, comp
Meaning only; merely; just; lit. one side
Construction eka + anta
Compound digu (eko + anto)
Synonym api, eva
Sanskrit ekānta

Example

na y'idaṃ bhāsitamattena,
ek'antasavanena vā,
anukkamitave sakkā,
yāyaṃ paṭipadā daḷhā,
yāya dhīrā pamuccanti,
jhāyino mārabandhanā.

SN 1.35 ujjhānasaññisuttaṃ

Sanskrit ekānta

Example

Grammar adj, in comps, comp
Meaning absolute; total; perfect; complete; lit. gone one side

Variant ekantigata
Sanskrit ekānta + gata

Example

ekantadukkha

adj. exclusively painful; totally unpleasant [ekanta + dukkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning exclusively painful; totally unpleasant
Construction ekanta + dukkha
Compound kammadhāraya (ekanta + dukkha)
Antonym ekantasukha
Commentary (MNa) ek'antadukkhā'ti niccadukkhā nirantaradukkhā. (ANa) ek'antadukkhan'ti ekanten'eva dukkhaṃ, na sukhasammissaṃ.
Sanskrit ekāntaduḥkha

Examples

rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, mahāli, ek'antadukkhaṃ abhavissa dukkh'ānupatitaṃ dukkh'āvakkantaṃ anavakkantaṃ sukhena, na'y'idaṃ sattā rūpasmiṃ sārajjeyyuṃ.

SN 22.60 mahālisuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ passāmi aparena samayena dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannaṃ, ek'antadukkhā tibbā kaṭukā vedanā vedayamānaṃ.

Antonym ekantakāḷaka
ekantasukha

adj. completely comfortable; perfectly pleasurable; totally happy; perfectly at ease [eka + anta + sukha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning completely comfortable; perfectly pleasurable; totally happy; perfectly at ease
Construction eka + anta + sukha
Compound kammadhāraya (ekanta + sukha)
Antonym ekantadukkha
Synonym ekantasukhī
Sanskrit ekānta + sukha

Examples

te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

rūpañ'ca h'idaṃ, mahāli, ek'antasukhaṃ abhavissa sukh'ānupatitaṃ sukh'āvakkantaṃ anavakkantaṃ dukkhena, na'y'idaṃ sattā rūpasmiṃ nibbindeyyuṃ.

SN 22.60 mahālisuttaṃ
ekantasukhappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. feeling completely comfortable; experiencing pure happiness; entirely at ease [ekantasukha + paṭisaṃvedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning feeling completely comfortable; experiencing pure happiness; entirely at ease
Construction ekantasukha + paṭisaṃvedī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ekantasukhaṃ + paṭisaṃvedī)
Sanskrit ekānta + sukha + pratisaṃvedin

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññatha, sakkā, api nu so puriso bhogahetu bhoganidānaṃ bhog'ādhikaraṇaṃ ekaṃ vā rattiṃ ekaṃ vā divasaṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā rattiṃ upaḍḍhaṃ vā divasaṃ ek'antasukhappaṭisaṃvedī vihareyyā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

AN 10.46 sakkasuttaṃ
ekantasukhī

adj. completely comfortable; totally happy; perfectly at ease [eka + anta + sukhī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning completely comfortable; totally happy; perfectly at ease
Construction eka + anta + sukhī
Compound kammadhāraya (ekanta + sukhī)
Synonym ekantasukha
Sanskrit ekānta + sukhin

Example

evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo
ekantasukhīsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 24.41 (SN24.41) ✗
ekantaṃ

ind. completely; exclusively; solely; only; lit. one sidedly [eka + anta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of ekanta
Meaning completely; exclusively; solely; only; lit. one sidedly
Construction eka + anta + aṃ
ekanta + aṃ
Compound digu (ekaṃ + antaṃ)
Synonym anavasesaṃ, asesato, asesaṃ, eva, kevalaṃ, paripūraṃ, samantaṃ, sammā, sādhukaṃ
Sanskrit ekāntam

Examples

sace, bhikkhave, adhicittam'anuyutto bhikkhu ek'antaṃ samādhinimittaṃ'y'eva manasi kareyya, ṭhānaṃ taṃ cittaṃ kosajjāya saṃvatteyya.

AN 3.103 nimittasuttaṃ

na c'āhu na ca bhavissati,
na c'eta'r'ahi vijjati,
ek'antaṃ nindito poso,
ek'antaṃ vā pasaṃsito.

DHP 228 kodhavaggo
ekantaṃkusalāyatika

adj. (comm) coming from what is absolutely good, resulting form what is good; or perhaps; producing what is absolutely good in the future ✗
ekantaṃgata

adj. with utter devotion or certainty; taking one side; following one alternative ✗
ekantaṃgatalomī 1

fem. (a bed with) a kind of rug or covering ✗
ekantaṃgatalomī 2

masc. (a bed with) a kind of rug or covering ✗
ekantika

adj. certain; definite ✗
ekantigata

adj. absolute; total; perfect; complete; lit. gone one side [eka + anta + gata] ~

Grammar adj, in comps, comp
Meaning absolute; total; perfect; complete; lit. gone one side
Construction eka + anta > anti + gata
Phonetic Change a > i before √gam
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ekantaṃ + gata)
Synonym accanta, ekanta, kevala, paripuṇṇa
Variant ekantagata
Sanskrit ekānta + gata
ekantena

ind. certainly; surely; definitely; invariably [eka + anta + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ekanta
Meaning certainly; surely; definitely; invariably
Construction eka + anta + ena
ekanta + ena
Synonym addhā, ekaṃsena, kāmaṃ, khu, kho, taggha, nissaṃsayaṃ, nissaṃsayena, vata, sasakkaṃ, saṃsakkaṃ, ssu, hi
Sanskrit ekāntena

Example

nissaṃsayena tvaṃ buddho bhavissasi, mayam'p'etaṃ jānāma, yass'etāni nimittāni paññāyanti, ek'antena so buddho hoti

Construction eka + pada
Compound digu (ekaṃ + padaṃ)
Antonym dvipada
Commentary (ANa) ekapadaṃ dvipadan'ti ekapadamantaṃ vā dvipadamantaṃ vā, ko mantaṃ jānātī'ti attho.
Sanskrit ekapada

Example

SN 1.10 araññasuttaṃ
ekabhattika

adj. who eats one meal a day; (comm) eating ten times before midday [eka + bhatta + ika] ✓

Construction eka + bhatta + ika
ekabhatta + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (MNa) ekabhattiko'ti pātarāsabhattaṃ sāyamāsabhattan'ti dve bhattāni. tesu pātarāsabhattaṃ antomajjh'anhikena paricchinnaṃ, itaraṃ majjh'anhikato uddhaṃ antoaruṇena. tasmā antomajjh'anhike dasakkhattuṃ bhuñjamāno'pi ekabhattiko'va hoti, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ ekabhattiko'ti.

Example

aratī n'ābhikīratī'ti.

SN 2.18 kakudhasuttaṃ
ekamidāhaṃ

sandhi. this one (time) I [ekaṃ + idaṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pron + pron
Meaning this one (time) I
Construction ekaṃ + idaṃ + ahaṃ
Sanskrit ekam + idam + aham

Examples

ekam'id'āhaṃ, āvuso ānanda, samayaṃ idh'eva sāvatthiyaṃ viharāmi andhavanasmiṃ. tatth'āhaṃ tathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ samāpajjiṃ yathā n'eva pathaviyaṃ pathavisaññī ahosiṃ

AN 10.7 sāriputtasuttaṃ

ekam'id'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, samayaṃ ukkaṭṭhāyaṃ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ
ekamūla

adj. with one root; with a single source; (comm) craving [eka + mūla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with one root; with a single source; (comm) craving
Construction eka + mūla
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + mūla)
Commentary (SNa) ekamūlan'ti avijjā taṇhāya mūlaṃ, taṇhā avijjāya. idha pana taṇhā adhippetā.
Notes (LDA) Now, what is this 'one root'? That too, we can understand in the light of the Phassamūlaka Sutta (SN 36.10) ... All feelings have contact as their only root (ekamūlaṃ).
Sanskrit ekamūla

Example

ekamūlaṃ dvi'r'āvaṭṭaṃ,
timalaṃ pañcapattharaṃ,
samuddaṃ dvādas'āvaṭṭaṃ,
pātālaṃ atarī isī'ti.

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.44 (SN1.44) ✗
ekamūlika

adj. (what is) based on one item; (a statement or exposition) concerned with one item ✗
ekameka 1

adj. each and every; every individual; lit. one one [ekaṃ + eka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning each and every; every individual; lit. one one
Construction ekaṃ + eka
Synonym ekeka
Sanskrit ekameka

Examples

ekam'ekañ'ca bhikkhuṃ paccekaṃ dussayugena acchādesi, āyasmantañ'ca ānandaṃ ticīvarena acchādesi, āyasmato ca ānandassa pañcasatavihāraṃ kārāpesī'ti.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ

vejayantassa kho, mārisa moggallāna, pāsādassa ekasataṃ niyyūhaṃ. ek'ekasmiṃ niyyūhe satta satta kūṭ'āgārasatāni. ekam'ekasmiṃ kūṭ'āgāre satta satta accharāyo. ekam'ekissā accharāya satta satta paricārikāyo.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
ekameka 2

masc. each and every person; every individual; lit. one one [ekaṃ + eka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning each and every person; every individual; lit. one one
Construction ekaṃ + eka
Sanskrit ekameka

Examples

atha kho āyasmā mahako āyasmantaṃ theraṃ etadavoca, sādhu khv'assa, bhante thera, sītako ca vāto vāyeyya, abbhasampilāpo ca assa, devo ca ekam'ekaṃ phusāyeyyā'ti.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, aggivessana, anekasatāya parisāya dhammaṃ desetā. apissu maṃ ekam'eko evaṃ maññati, mam'ev'ārabbha samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ desetī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ekamekaṃ

ind. one by one; singly ✗
ekamekena

ind. by each and every; through every individual; lit. one with one [ekaṃ + eka + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ekameka
Meaning by each and every; through every individual; lit. one with one
Construction ekaṃ + eka + ena
ekameka + ena
Sanskrit ekamekena

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, purisassa agāraṃ ekādasadvāraṃ, so tasmiṃ agāre āditte ekam'ekena'pi dvārena sakkuṇeyya attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ. evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
ekampi

sandhi. only one; just one; merely a single [ekaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning only one; just one; merely a single
Construction ekaṃ + api
Sanskrit ekam + api

Examples

ekam'pi ce pāṇam'aduṭṭhacitto,
mettāyati kusalī tena hoti,
sabbe ca pāṇe manasānukampī,
pahūtamariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

AN 8.1 mettāsuttaṃ

so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

Example

pathabyā ekarajjena,
saggassa gamanena vā,
sabbalok'ādhipaccena,
sot'āpattiphalaṃ varaṃ.

DHP 178 lokavaggo
ekaratta

nt. one night; single night; one night alone [eka + ratta] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one night; single night; one night alone
Construction eka + ratta
Compound digu (ekaṃ + rattaṃ)
Sanskrit ekarātra

Examples

bhagavā etadavoca, bhadd'ekarattassa vo, bhikkhave, uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca desessāmi. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ

evaṃ vihāriṃ ātāpiṃ,
ahorattam'atanditaṃ.
taṃ ve bhadda-ekaratto'ti,
santo ācikkhate munī'ti.

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
ekarattampi

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind

Construction ekarattaṃ + api
Sanskrit ekarātra + api

Examples

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ

bhikkhunupassayo nāma yattha bhikkhuniyo ekarattam'pi vasanti.

VIN 2.5.3.3 bhikkhunupassayasikkhāpadaṃ
ekarattaṃ

ind. for one night [eka + ratta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of akeratta
Meaning for one night
Construction eka + ratta + aṃ
ekaratta + aṃ
Compound digu (ekaṃ + rattaṃ)
Sanskrit ekarātra

Examples

niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine ekarattam'pi ce bhikkhu ticīvarena vippavaseyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 2 udositasikkhāpadaṃ

sace te, bhaggava, agaru viharemu āvesane ekarattan'ti. na kho me, bhante, garu. atthi c'ettha pabbajito paṭhamaṃ vās'ūpagato. sace so anujānāti, viharatha, bhante, yathāsukhan'ti.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ekaratti

fem. one night [eka + ratti] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning one night
Construction eka + ratti
ekarattiparivāsa 1

adj. (of a journey) staying for one night; (comm) completing in one night [ekaratti + parivāsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of a journey) staying for one night; (comm) completing in one night
Construction ekaratti + parivāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (ekaratti + parivāsa)
Commentary (UDa) ekarattiparivāsenā'ti sabbasmiṃ magge ekarattivāsen'eva agamāsi. suppārakapaṭṭanato hi sāvatthi vīsayojanasate hoti, tañcāyaṃ ettakaṃ addhānaṃ ekarattivāsena agamāsi. yadā suppārakato nikkhanto, tadah'eva sāvatthiṃ sampatto'ti.
Sanskrit eka + rātri + parivāsa

Example

atha kho bāhiyo dārucīriyo tāya devatāya saṃvejito tāva'd'eva suppārakamhā pakkāmi. sabbattha ekarattiparivāsena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṃ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo ten'upasaṅkami.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
ekarattiparivāsa 2

masc. interval of one night; duration of one day [ekaratti + parivāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning interval of one night; duration of one day
Construction ekaratti + parivāsa
Sanskrit eka + rātri + parivāsa
ekarattivāsa 1

masc. staying for one night [ekaratti + vāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning staying for one night
Construction ekaratti + vāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (ekaratti + vāsa)
Sanskrit eka + rātri + vāsa

Examples

akkodhano vigatakhilo'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiy'ekarattivāso,
vivaṭā kuṭi nibbuto gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2

so taṃ ādāya sabbattha ekarattivāsena gacchanto ekaṃ phāsukaṭṭhānaṃ patvā nivāsaṃ gaṇhi

DHPa 1.4.8 visākhā vatthu

masc. passing of a single night [ekaratti + vāsa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning passing of a single night
Construction ekaratti + vāsa
Compound kammadhāraya (ekaratti + vāsa)
Sanskrit eka + rātri + vāsa
ekarasa

adj. having one taste; with a single flavour [eka + rasa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having one taste; with a single flavour
Construction eka + rasa
Sanskrit ekarasa (the only pleasure)

Example

seyyathā'pi mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso, evam'eva kho ayaṃ dhammavinayo ekaraso vimuttiraso.

nāmānaṃ ekavibhattikānaṃ yo samuccayo, so dvandasañño hoti.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 329
ekavihāra 1

masc. living alone; living in solitude [eka + vihāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning living alone; living in solitude
Construction eka + vihāra
Compound digu (eko + vihāro)
Sanskrit eka + vihārin

Example

kathañ'ca, thera, ekavihāro vitthārena paripuṇṇo hoti. idha, thera, yaṃ atītaṃ taṃ pahīnaṃ, yaṃ anāgataṃ taṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, paccuppannesu ca attabhāvapaṭilābhesu chandarāgo suppaṭivinīto.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ
ekavihāra 2

masc. one house; a single dwelling [eka + vihāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one house; a single dwelling
Construction eka + vihāra
Compound digu (eko + vihāro)
Commentary (UDa) ekavihāre'ti ekagandhakuṭiyaṃ. gandhakuṭi hi idha vihāro'ti adhippetā.
Sanskrit eka + vihāra

Example

atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi, yassa kho maṃ bhagavā āṇāpeti, imass'ānanda, āgantukassa bhikkhuno sen'āsanaṃ paññāpehī'ti, icchati bhagavā tena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekavihāre vatthuṃ, icchati bhagavā āyasmatā soṇena saddhiṃ ekavihāre vatthun'ti.

UD 46 soṇasuttaṃ
ekavihāriyattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 234 (TH234) ✗
ekavihārī

adj. hermetic; who lives alone [eka + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning hermetic; who lives alone
Construction eka + vihārī
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + vihārī)
Antonym sadutiyavihārī
Sanskrit eka + vihārin

Examples

tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu theranāmako ekavihārī c'eva hoti ekavihārassa ca vaṇṇavādī.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ

sabb'ābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ,
sabbesu dhammesu anūpalittaṃ,
sabbañ'jahaṃ taṇhākkhaye vimuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ naraṃ ekavihārī'ti brūmī'ti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ

ITI 15 taṇhāsaṃyojanasuttaṃ
ekasāṭaka 1

masc. ascetic wearing a loin-cloth; one robe ascetic; lit. one cloth [eka + sāṭa + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ascetic wearing a loin-cloth; one robe ascetic; lit. one cloth
Construction eka + sāṭa + ka
ekasāṭa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound digu > bahubbīhi (eko + sāṭako)
Commentary (ANa) ekasāṭakā'ti eken'eva pilotikakhaṇḍena purato paṭicchādanakā.
Sanskrit eka + śāṭaka

Examples

tena kho pana samayena satta ca jaṭilā satta ca nigaṇṭhā satta ca acelakā satta ca ekasāṭakā satta ca paribbājakā parūḷhakacchanakhalomā khārivividham'ādāya bhagavato avidūre atikkamanti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena lohit'ābhijāti paññattā, nigaṇṭhā ekasāṭakā.

ekasāṭaka 2

ekaṃ samayaṃ

idiom. at one time; on one occasion ✓

Grammar idiom, card + masc
Meaning at one time; on one occasion

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

SN 1.11 nandanasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, ārādhayiṃsu vata me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ekaṃ samayaṃ cittaṃ. idh'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āmantesiṃ, ahaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjāmi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
ekaṃyeva

sandhi. only one; just one [ekaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning only one; just one
Construction ekaṃ + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit ekam + eva

Examples

hatthidamakena, bhikkhave, hatthidammo sārito ekaṃ'y'eva disaṃ dhāvati, puratthimaṃ vā pacchimaṃ vā uttaraṃ vā dakkhiṇaṃ vā.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

taṃ vā pana anabhisambhavaṃ appaṭivijjhaṃ tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā ekabījī hoti, ekaṃ'y'eva mānusakaṃ bhavaṃ nibbattetvā dukkhass'antaṃ karoti.

AN 3.89 tatiyasikkhāsuttaṃ
ekaṃsa 1

adj. definite; sure; straight; with absolute assurance; lit. one part [eka + aṃsa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning definite; sure; straight; with absolute assurance; lit. one part
Construction eka + aṃsa
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + aṃsa)
Synonym ekanta, ekaṃsika
Sanskrit ekāṃśa

Example

atthi, bhikkhave, pañho ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho vibhajjavyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho paṭipucchāvyākaraṇīyo, atthi, bhikkhave, pañho ṭhapanīyo

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ
ekaṃsa 2

masc. one part; one side; single component [eka + aṃsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning one part; one side; single component
Construction eka + aṃsa
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + aṃsa)
Commentary (MNa) ek'aṃsaṃ ... ek'antaṃ ekakoṭṭhāsaṃ
Sanskrit ekāṃśa

Example

evam'ass'āyaṃ apaṇṇako dhammo dussamatto samādinno, ek'aṃsaṃ pharitvā tiṭṭhati, riñcati kusalaṃ ṭhānaṃ.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
ekaṃsa 3

adj. pertaining to one shoulder ✗
ekaṃsabyākaraṇīya

adj. which should be given a straight answer; which should be answered categorically [ekaṃsa + byākaraṇīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which should be given a straight answer; which should be answered categorically
Construction ekaṃsa + byākaraṇīya
Compound kammadhāraya (ekaṃsa + byākaraṇīya)
Variant ekaṃsavyākaraṇīya
Sanskrit eka + aṃśa + vyākaraṇīya

Examples

sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

atthi bhikkhave pañho ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyo, atthi pañho ṭhapanīyo.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ
ekaṃsabhavita

adj. developed in one part; practised for one aspect ✗
ekaṃsabhāvita

adj. developed on one side; one-sided ✗
ekaṃsabhāvitasamādhi

masc. one-sided samadhi; lopsided meditation ✗
ekaṃsavacana

nt. straight answer; definite statement; categorical answer [ekaṃsa + vacana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning straight answer; definite statement; categorical answer
Construction ekaṃsa + vacana
Compound kammadhāraya (ekaṃsa + vacana)
Sanskrit eka + aṃśa + vacana

Example

ek'aṃsavacanaṃ ekaṃ,
vibhajjavacan'āparaṃ,
tatiyaṃ paṭipuccheyya,
catutthaṃ pana ṭhāpaye.

AN 4.42 pañhabyākaraṇasuttaṃ
ekaṃsavāda

adj. speaking with absolute certainty; having absolute views ✗
ekaṃsavyākaraṇiya

adj. answerable; to be answered with certainty, or with an absolute affirmation ✗
ekaṃsaṃ

ind. on one shoulder; over one shoulder [eka + aṃsa + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of ekaṃsa
Meaning on one shoulder; over one shoulder
Construction eka + aṃsa + aṃ
ekaṃsa + aṃ
Sanskrit adhyaṃsa

Examples

ek'aṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ katvā,
saṃharitvāna pāṇayo,
anucaṅkamissaṃ virajaṃ,
sabbasattānam'uttamaṃ.

TH 227 sopākattheragāthā

kālass'eva vuṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukh'odakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā

idiom. having arranged one’s robe over one shoulder ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + masc + abs
Meaning having arranged one’s robe over one shoulder
Variant ekaṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ katvā

Examples

atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

kālass'eva vuṭṭhāya upāhanā omuñcitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttar'āsaṅgaṃ karitvā dantakaṭṭhaṃ dātabbaṃ, mukh'odakaṃ dātabbaṃ, āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ.

VIN 4.1.15 upajjhāya vatta kathā
ekaṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ katvā

idiom. having arranged one’s robe over one shoulder ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + nt + abs
Meaning having arranged one’s robe over one shoulder
Variant ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā

Examples

atha kho āyasmā selo sapariso yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ katvā yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi

MN 92 selasuttaṃ

uṭṭhāy'āsanā ek'aṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ katvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
ekaṃsika 1

adj. definite; sure; certain; lit. one part [eka + aṃsa + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning definite; sure; certain; lit. one part
Construction eka + aṃsa + ika
ekaṃsa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Antonym anekaṃsika
Synonym ekanta, ekaṃsa, dhuva, yāthāva
Sanskrit ekāṃśika (bsk)

Examples

na kho pana mayaṃ kiñci samaṇassa gotamassa ek'aṃsikaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāma, sassato loko'ti vā, asassato loko'ti vā, antavā loko'ti vā, anantavā loko'ti vā

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

sabb'eva kho ete, poṭṭhapāda, paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā, tvaṃ'y'eva nesaṃ eko cakkhumā. ek'aṃsikā'pi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā, anek'aṃsikā'pi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā.

DN 9.5 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, cittahatthisāriputtapoṭṭhapādavatthu
ekaṃsika 2

adj. pertaining to one shoulder ✗
ekaṃsikadhamma

masc. certain matter ✗
ekaṃsena

ind. certainly; definitely; absolutely; categorically; lit. one point-ness [eka + aṃsa + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of ekaṃsa
Meaning certainly; definitely; absolutely; categorically; lit. one point-ness
Construction eka + aṃsa + ena
ekaṃsa + ena
Synonym ekantena, sasakkaṃ, saṃsakkaṃ, ssu, hi
Sanskrit ekāṃśa

Examples

ek'aṃsena gotami dhāreyyāsi eso dhammo eso vinayo etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ

sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
ekā 1

card. one; first one [eka + ā] ✓

Grammar card, fem nom sg of eka
Meaning one; first one
Construction eka + ā
Sanskrit ekā

Examples

rūpī rūpāni passati, ayaṃ ekā disā, ajjhattaṃ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati, ayaṃ dutiyā disā, subhan'tv'eva adhimutto hoti, ayaṃ tatiyā disā

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

tāsaṃ ce, āvuso, naḷakalāpīnaṃ ekaṃ ākaḍḍheyya, ekā papateyya, aparaṃ ce ākaḍḍheyya, aparā papateyya. evam'eva kho, āvuso, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
ekā 2

adj. some [eka] ✗
ekākika

adj. alone, solitary ✗
ekākinī

fem. lonely person [eka] ✗
ekākiya

adj. alone; solitary [ekākī + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from ekākī
Meaning alone; solitary
Construction ekākī + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Synonym eka, ekaka
Sanskrit ekākin

Example

kadā nu'haṃ pabbatakandarāsu,
ekākiyo addutiyo vihassaṃ,
aniccato sabbabhavaṃ vipassaṃ,
taṃ me idaṃ taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
ekākī

adj. alone; solitary [eka] ✗
ekāgārika 1.1

masc. home invasion; lit. one house-er [eka + agārika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning home invasion; lit. one house-er
Construction eka + agārika
Compound digu (eko + agāriko)
Commentary (MNa) ek'āgārikan'ti paṇṇāsamattā'pi saṭṭhimattā'pi parivāretvā jīvaggāhaṃ gahetvā āharāpenti. (ANa) ek'āgārikan'ti ekam'eva gehaṃ parivāretvā vilumpanaṃ.
Sanskrit aikāgārika

Examples

tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhim'pi chindati, nillopam'pi harati, ek'āgārikam'pi karoti, paripanthe'pi tiṭṭhati. katamehi tīhi?

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu sandhim'pi chindanti, nillopam'pi haranti, ek'āgārikam'pi karonti, paripanthe'pi tiṭṭhanti, paradāram'pi gacchanti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
ekāgārika 2.1

masc. ascetic who subsists on food from only one house; lit. one house-er [eka + āgārika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ascetic who subsists on food from only one house; lit. one house-er
Construction eka + āgārika
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + āgārika)
Commentary (DNa) ek'āgāriko'ti yo ekasmiṃ'y'eva gehe bhikkhaṃ labhitvā nivattati
Sanskrit eka + āgārika

Example

te ek'āgārikā vā honti ek'ālopikā, dv'āgārikā vā honti dv'ālopikā ... satt'āgārikā vā honti satt'ālopikā. ekissā'pi dattiyā yāpenti, dvīhi'pi dattīhi yāpenti ... sattahi'pi dattīhi yāpenti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ekācariya

masc. one teacher; a single teacher ✗
ekācariyapācariya

masc. one teacher's teacher; a single former teacher ✗
ekādasa 1

card. eleven (11) [eka + dasa + *a] ✓

Grammar card, x pl, comp
Meaning eleven (11)
Construction eka > ekā + dasa + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound dvanda (eka ca dasa ca)
Sanskrit ekādaśa

Examples

mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādasa-ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

AN 11.15 mettāsuttaṃ

ekādasahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gopālako abhabbo gogaṇaṃ pariharituṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ. katamehi ekādasahi?

AN 11.17 gopālasuttaṃ
ekādasa 2

ordin. eleventh (11th) [eka + dasa + *a] ✓

Grammar ordin of ekādasa, comp
Meaning eleventh (11th)
Construction eka > ekā + dasa + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Compound dvanda (eka ca dasa ca)
Synonym ekādasama
Sanskrit ekādaśa

Examples

taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ hotī'ti ekādase aruṇ'uggamane nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

akālacīvaraṃ nāma anatthate kathine ekādasamāse uppannaṃ, atthate kathine sattamāse uppannaṃ, kāle'pi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
ekādasaka

adj. eleventh; related to eleven; consisting of eleven parts [eka + dasa + *a + ka] ~

Grammar adj, comp, from ekādasa
Meaning eleventh; related to eleven; consisting of eleven parts
Construction eka > ekā + dasa + *a + ka
ekādasa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit ekādaśaka
ekādasakanipāta 1

masc. Book 11 of the Aṅguttara Nikāya; Book of Elevens [ekādasaka + nipāta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Book 11 of the Aṅguttara Nikāya; Book of Elevens
Construction ekādasaka + nipāta
ekādasakanipāta 2

masc. Chapter 11 of the Jātaka ✗
ekādasakanipātapāḷi

fem. Book 11 of the Aṅguttara Nikāya; Book of Elevens ✗
ekādasadvāra

adj. having eleven doors; with eleven entrances [ekādasa + dvāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having eleven doors; with eleven entrances
Construction ekādasa + dvāra
Compound kammadhāraya (ekādasa + dvāra)
Sanskrit ekādaśa + dvāra

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, purisassa agāraṃ ekādasadvāraṃ, so tasmiṃ agāre āditte ekam'ekena'pi dvārena sakkuṇeyya attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ. evam'eva kho ahaṃ, bhante, imesaṃ ekādasannaṃ amatadvārānaṃ ekam'ekena'pi amatadvārena sakkuṇissāmi attānaṃ sotthiṃ kātuṃ.

MN 52 aṭṭhakanāgarasuttaṃ
ekādasanipāta 1

masc. Chapter 11 of the Theragāthā (TH240) ✗
ekādasanipāta 2

masc. Chapter 10 of the Therīgāthā (THI63) ✗

adj. who possesses eleven requisites [ekādasa + parikkhārika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who possesses eleven requisites
Construction ekādasa + parikkhārika
ekādasama

ordin. eleventh (11th) [eka + dasa + *a + ma] ✓

Grammar ordin of ekādasa, comp
Meaning eleventh (11th)
Construction eka > ekā + dasa + *a + ma
ekādasa + ma
Derivative taddhita (ma)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ekādasa
Sanskrit ekādaśama

Examples

iti h'etaṃ vijānāma,
ekādasamo so parābhavo,
dvādasamaṃ bhagavā brūhi,
kiṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6

ayaṃ vasabhasaṃvacchare hem'antautu. asmiṃ utumhi māghamāsassa kāḷapakkhe ekādasamaṃ, candavāram'idan'ti daṭṭhabbaṃ.

Sri Lanka buddhavassasajjhāyanā
ekādasamasikkhāpada

nt. eleventh rule [ekādasama + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning eleventh rule
Construction ekādasama + sikkhāpada
ekādasamasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.133 (AN10.133) ✗
ekādasamāsa

masc. eleventh month robe-season after kathina [ekādasa + māsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning eleventh month robe-season after kathina
Construction ekādasa + māsa
Compound digu (ekādaso + māso)
Commentary (VINa) ekādasamāse'ti ekaṃ pacchimakattikamāsaṃ ṭhapetvā sese ekādasamāse.
Sanskrit ekādaśa + māsa

Example

akālacīvaraṃ nāma anatthate kathine ekādasamāse uppannaṃ, atthate kathine sattamāse uppannaṃ, kāle'pi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
ekādasānisaṃsā

masc. eleven benefits; eleven advantages [ekādasa + ānisaṃsa + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning eleven benefits; eleven advantages
Construction ekādasa + ānisaṃsa + ā
ekādasānisaṃsa + ā
Compound digu (ekādasa + ānisaṃsā)
Sanskrit ekādaśa + anuśaṃsa (bsk)

Example

mettāya, bhikkhave, cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ime ekādas'ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhāti.

AN 11.15 mettāsuttaṃ
ekānupassanā

fem. one observation; one contemplation; one insight [eka + anupassanā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning one observation; one contemplation; one insight
Construction eka + anupassanā
Compound digu (ekā + anupassanā)
Antonym dutiyānupassanā
Sanskrit eka + anudarśana

Examples

idaṃ dukkhaṃ, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo'ti ayam'ek'ānupassanā. ayaṃ dukkhanirodho, ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā'ti, ayaṃ dutiy'ānupassanā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

yaṃ kiñci dukkhaṃ sambhoti sabbaṃ upadhipaccayā'ti, ayam'ek'ānupassanā. upadhīnaṃ tv'eva asesavirāganirodhā n'atthi dukkhassa sambhavo'ti, ayaṃ dutiy'ānupassanā.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
ekānusandhika

adj. with one theme; on one topic [eka + anusandhika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with one theme; on one topic
Construction eka + anusandhika
Antonym anekānusandhika
ekābaddha

adj. man's own ✗
ekābhidhāna

nt. (gram) mentioning together; taking together; one expression [eka + abhidhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (gram) mentioning together; taking together; one expression
Construction eka + abhidhāna
Compound digu (eko + abhidhāno)
Sanskrit eka + abhidhāna

Examples

409, 441. sabbesam'ek'ābhidhāne paro puriso.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 409

sabbesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ paṭhamamajjhim'uttamapurisānaṃ ek'ābhidhāne paro puriso gahetabbo. so ca paṭhati, tvañ'ca paṭhasi, tumhe paṭhatha. so ca pacati, tvañ'ca pacasi. tumhe pacatha. evaṃ sesāsu vibhattīsu paro puriso yojetabbo.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 409
ekāya

card. with one (woman) [eka + āya] ✓

Grammar card, fem instr sg of eka
Meaning with one (woman)
Construction eka + āya
Variant ekissā
Sanskrit ekayā

Examples

atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā kumārikā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā tassā kumārikāya saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṃkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesi kālayuttaṃ samullapanto kālayuttaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇanto

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyata sikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṃkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappeyya

VIN PAT AN 1 paṭhamaaniyatasikkhāpadaṃ
ekāyana

adj. direct; one-way [eka + ayana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning direct; one-way
Construction eka + ayana
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + ayana)
Commentary (MNa) ekāyanena maggenā'ti ekapathen'eva maggena, anukkamaniyena ubhosu passesu nirantarakaṇṭakarukkhagahanena.
Sanskrit ekāyana

Examples

ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā

DN 22.1 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito ekāyanena maggena tam'eva aṅgārakāsuṃ paṇidhāya. tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso disvā evaṃ vadeyya, tath'āyaṃ bhavaṃ puriso paṭipanno tathā ca iriyati tañ'ca maggaṃ samārūḷho, yathā imaṃ'y'eva aṅgārakāsuṃ āgamissatī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
ekāyeva

sandhi. just one; only one [ekā + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning just one; only one
Construction ekā + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit ekā + eva

Example

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā itthisahassānaṃ ekā'y'eva sā itthī hoti yā maṃ tena samayena paccupaṭṭhāti, khattiyānī vā velāmikā vā.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
ekāra 1.1

adj. with a single spoke [eka + ara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a single spoke
Construction eka + ara
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + ara)
Commentary (UDa) eko satisaṅkhāto aro etassā'ti ek'āro.
ekāra 2.1

masc. (gram) letter e; 7th letter of the alphabet; gutturo-palatal vowel [e + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter e; 7th letter of the alphabet; gutturo-palatal vowel
Construction e + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (e + kāra)
Synonym etta
Sanskrit ekāra

Examples

sare pare antassa ekārassa kvaci yo ādeso hoti.

bālāvatāra sarasandhi

te o e'icc'ete āva āy'ādese pāpuṇanti kārite. lāveti, nāyeti. yogavibhāgena aññasmim'pi ekārassa āy'ādeso hoti. gāyati, gāyanti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 515
ekāra 3.1

masc. (gram) vuddhi form of the letters i and ī; lit. letter e [i + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) vuddhi form of the letters i and ī; lit. letter e
Construction i + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (i + kāra)
Sanskrit e

Example

ekārassa dhātv'antassa sare pare ay'ādeso hoti. nayati, jayati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 514
ekārakkha

adj. with a single guard [eka + ārakkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with a single guard
Construction eka + ārakkha
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + ārakkha)
Commentary (NIDD1a) ek'ārakkho'ti satiārakkhena eko uttamo ārakkho assā'ti ek'ārakkho.
Sanskrit eka + ārakṣa

Example

kathañ'c'āvuso, bhikkhu ek'ārakkho hoti? idh'āvuso, bhikkhu sat'ārakkhena cetasā samannāgato hoti.

DN 33.13 saṅgītisuttaṃ
ekārammaṇa

nt. one basis ✗
ekārāmatā

fem. delight in solitude ✗
ekālopika

masc. ascetic who subsists on only one mouthful of food; lit. one morsel-er [eka + ālopika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ascetic who subsists on only one mouthful of food; lit. one morsel-er
Construction eka + ālopika
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + ālopika)
Commentary (DNa) ek'ālopiko'ti yo eken'eva ālopena yāpeti. dv'āgārik'ādīsu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit eka + ālopaka (bsk)

Example

te ek'āgārikā vā honti ek'ālopikā, dv'āgārikā vā honti dv'ālopikā ... satt'āgārikā vā honti satt'ālopikā. ekissā'pi dattiyā yāpenti, dvīhi'pi dattīhi yāpenti ... sattahi'pi dattīhi yāpenti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ekāsana 1

adj. sitting alone; lit. one seat [eka + āsana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning sitting alone; lit. one seat
Construction eka + āsana
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + āsana)
Sanskrit eka + āsana

Example

ek'āsanaṃ ekaseyyaṃ,
eko caram'atandito,
eko damayam'attānaṃ,
van'ante ramito siyā.

DHP 305 pakiṇṇakavaggo
ekāsana 2

nt. solitude; lit. one seat [eka + āsana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning solitude; lit. one seat
Construction eka + āsana
Compound digu (ekaṃ + āsanaṃ)
Sanskrit eka + āsana

Examples

ek'āsanassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ekattaṃ monam'akkhātaṃ,
eko ce abhiramissasi,
atha bhāhisi dasadisā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

subhāsitassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ek'āsanassa ca raho,
cittavūpasamassa cā'ti.

SN 2.1 paṭhamakassapasuttaṃ
ekāsana 3

nt. one sitting; one time; lit. one seat [eka + āsana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one sitting; one time; lit. one seat
Construction eka + āsana
Compound digu (ekaṃ + āsanaṃ)
Sanskrit eka + āsana

Examples

gilānasamayo nāma na sakkoti ek'āsane nisinno yāva'd'atthaṃ bhuñjituṃ, gilānasamayo'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.

VIN 2.5.4.3 paramparabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

MN 65 bhaddālisuttaṃ
ekāsana 4

nt. one seat; one chair ✗
ekāsanabhojana

nt. eating in one sitting; (comm) eating up to seven times between dawn and noon [ekāsana + bhojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning eating in one sitting; (comm) eating up to seven times between dawn and noon
Construction ekāsana + bhojana
Compound sattamī tappurisa (ekāsanasmiṃ + bhojana)
Commentary (MNa) ek'āsanabhojanan'ti ekaṃ purebhattabhojanaṃ. sūriy'uggamanato hi yāva majjh'anhikā sattakkhattuṃ bhuttabhojanam'pi idha ek'āsanabhojanan't'eva adhippetaṃ.
Sanskrit eka + āsana + bhojana

Examples

ahaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjāmi. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, bhuñjamāno app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānāmi app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'ca.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.

MN 65 bhaddālisuttaṃ
ekāsanika

masc. ascetic who eats once a day; who eats in one sitting [eka + āsana + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from ekāsana
Meaning ascetic who eats once a day; who eats in one sitting
Construction eka + āsana + ika
ekāsana + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Compound digu (ekaṃ + āsanikaṃ)
Sanskrit ekāsanika

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ek'āsaniko hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi ek'āsaniko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na ek'āsanikā'ti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

ek'āsanik'aṅgaṃ pattapiṇḍik'aṅgaṃ khalupacchābhattik'aṅgaṃ āraññik'aṅgaṃ rukkhamūlik'aṅgaṃ abbhokāsik'aṅgaṃ sosānik'aṅgaṃ

MIL 5.4.2 dhutaṅgapañho
ekāsanikaṅga

nt. practice of eating at one sitting ✗
ekāsanikatā

fem. fact of being an ascetic who eats once a day; fact of eating in one sitting [eka + āsana + ika + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from ekāsanika
Meaning fact of being an ascetic who eats once a day; fact of eating in one sitting
Construction eka + āsana + ika + tā
ekāsanika + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit ekāsanika
ekāsanikatta

nt. fact of being an ascetic who eats in one sitting [eka + āsana + ika + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from ekāsanika
Meaning fact of being an ascetic who eats in one sitting
Construction eka + āsana + ika + tta
ekāsanika + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit ekāsanika + tva

Examples

ahaṃ kho'mhi ek'āsaniko, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na ek'āsanikā'ti. so tena ek'āsanikattena attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayam'pi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ek'āsanikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṃ gacchanti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
ekāsanikasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.188 (AN5.188) ✗
ekāsanī

adj. eating only at one sitting each day; (or possibly: sitting alone) ✗
ekāha

nt. one day [eka + aha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one day
Construction eka + aha
Compound digu (ekaṃ + ahaṃ)
Synonym ekadivasa
Sanskrit ekāha

Examples

yo ca vassasataṃ jīve,
dussīlo asamāhito,
ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo,
sīlavantassa jhāyino.

DHP 110 sahassavaggo

puna caparaṃ bhikkhave bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ekāhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātaṃ

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
ekāhamata

adj. dead for one day; one day deceased [eka + aha + mata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dead for one day; one day deceased
Construction eka + aha + mata
Compound kammadhāraya (ekāha + mata)
Commentary (DNa) ek'āhaṃ matassa assā'ti ek'āhamataṃ.
Sanskrit ekāha + mṛta

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ ek'āhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātaṃ.

MN 119 kāyagatāsatisuttaṃ

ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ek'āhamataṃ vā dvī'hamataṃ vā tī'hamataṃ vā uddhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbakajātan'ti?

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ
ekāhaṃ

ind. for one day, during one day ✗
ekāhika

adj. one-day ✗
ekāhikaṃ

ind. once a day; (comm) with one day in-between [eka + aha + ika + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of akāhika
Meaning once a day; (comm) with one day in-between
Construction eka + aha + ika + aṃ
ekāhika + aṃ
Commentary (DNa) ek'āhikan'ti ekadivas'antarikaṃ.
Sanskrit ekāhika (bsk)

Example

ek'āhikam'pi āhāraṃ āhārenti, dvī'hikam'pi āhāraṃ āhārenti ... satt'āhikam'pi āhāraṃ āhārenti. iti evarūpaṃ addhamāsikam'pi pariyāyabhattabhojan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharantī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
ekāhena

ind. in one day, in a single day; during that same day ✗
ekāhenamata

adj. who has been dead for one day, being a day old corpse ✗
ekikā

fem. woman alone; solitary woman [eka + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from eka
Meaning woman alone; solitary woman
Construction eka + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Sanskrit ekikā

Example

sataṃ sahassāni'pi dhuttakānaṃ,
idh'āgatā t'ādisakā bhaveyyuṃ,
lomaṃ na iñjāmi na santasāmi,
na māra bhāyāmi tam'ekikā'pi.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ
ekidaṃ

ind. some ✗
ekindriya

adj. with a single sense faculty; having one sense; i.e. plants [eka + indriya] ~

Construction eka + indriya

ekibhāva

masc. unity; harmony; lit. one state [eka + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning unity; harmony; lit. one state
Construction eka > eki + bhāva
Phonetic Change a > i before √bhū
Compound digu (eko + bhāvo)
Synonym samagga
Variant ekībhāva
Commentary (ANa) ekībhāvāyā'ti ekabhāv'atthāya ninnānākaraṇāya.
Sanskrit eka + bhāva

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ vacīkammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca. ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekibhāvāya saṃvattati.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
ekissā

card. with one; by one [eka + issā] ✓

Grammar card, fem instr sg of eka
Meaning with one; by one
Construction eka + issā
Synonym ekena
Variant ekāya
Commentary (DNa) ekissā'pi dattiyā'ti ekāya dattiyā.
Sanskrit ekayā

Examples

te ek'āgārikā vā honti ek'ālopikā, dv'āgārikā vā honti dv'ālopikā ... satt'āgārikā vā honti satt'ālopikā. ekissā'pi dattiyā yāpenti, dvīhi'pi dattīhi yāpenti ... sattahi'pi dattīhi yāpenti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

ekissā'pi, bhante, sattiyā haññamāno tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyetha, ko pana vādo tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno'ti!

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ
ekībhāva 1

masc. unity; harmony; becoming one; lit. one state [eka + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning unity; harmony; becoming one; lit. one state
Construction eka > ekī + bhāva
Phonetic Change a > ī before √bhū
Compound digu (eko + bhāvo)
Synonym samagga
Variant ekibhāva
Commentary (ANa) ekībhāvāyā'ti ekabhāv'atthāya ninnānākaraṇāya.
Sanskrit eka + bhāva

Examples

addhā ayam'āyasmā jānaṃ jānāti passaṃ passatī'ti. ayam'pi dhammo piyattāya garuttāya bhāvanāya sāmaññāya ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

AN 8.2 paññāsuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca, ayam'pi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṅgho samaggo sammodamāno avivadamāno ek'uddeso phāsu viharati. saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, samagge na c'eva aññam'aññaṃ akkosā honti

ek'ūnatiṃsatime saṃvacchare mah'ābhinikkhamanaṃ nikkhamitvā, chabbassāni mahāpadānaṃ padahitvā

Commentary (VINa) gāmo ek'ūpacāro'tiādi avippavāsalakkhaṇavavatthāpan'atthaṃ vuttaṃ. tato paraṃ yathākkamena tān'eva pannarasa mātikāpadāni vitthārento gāmo ekūpacāro nāmā'tiādim'āha.
eke

adj. some; some people [eka + e] ✓

Grammar adj, masc nom and acc pl of eka
Meaning some; some people
Construction eka + e
Sanskrit eke, ekān

Examples

yañ'hi eke jigucchanti,
mataṃ disvāna pāpakaṃ,
kāmarāgo pāturahu,
andho'va savatī ahuṃ.

TH 198 rājadattattheragāthā

yam'āhu saccaṃ tathiyan'ti eke,
tam'āhu aññe tucchaṃ musā'ti,
evam'pi vigayha vivādayanti,
kasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
ekeka 1

Meaning one by one individual; single; separate
Construction eka + eka
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + eka)
Synonym puthu
Sanskrit ekaika

Example

ek'ekalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, ek'ekāni lomāni lomakūpesu jātāni, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

adj. each and every; every individual [eka + eka] ✓

Meaning each and every; every individual
Construction eka + eka
Compound kammadhāraya (eka + eka)
Synonym ekameka
Sanskrit ekaika

Example

vejayantassa kho, mārisa moggallāna, pāsādassa ekasataṃ niyyūhaṃ. ek'ekasmiṃ niyyūhe satta satta kūṭ'āgārasatāni. ekam'ekasmiṃ kūṭ'āgāre satta satta accharāyo. ekam'ekissā accharāya satta satta paricārikāyo.

JAa 4 cūḷaseṭṭhijātakavaṇṇanā
ekena

card. by one; with one [eka + ena] ✓

Grammar card, masc and nt instr sg of eka
Meaning by one; with one
Construction eka + ena
Synonym ekissā
Sanskrit ekena

Examples

ekena'pi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuṃ abbheyya, so ca bhikkhu anabbhito, te ca bhikkhū gārayhā, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso

atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi, icchām'ahaṃ, bhikkhave, aḍḍhamāsaṃ paṭisallīyituṃ. n'āmhi kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakenā'ti.

SN 54.9 vesālīsuttaṃ
ekenapi

sandhi. by even one; with only a single [ekena + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, card + ind
Meaning by even one; with only a single
Construction ekena + api
Sanskrit ekena + api

Examples

ekena'pi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuṃ abbheyya, so ca bhikkhu anabbhito, te ca bhikkhū gārayhā, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso

kārāpeyyā'ti ekena'pi kosiy'aṃsunā missitvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.2.1 kosiyasikkhāpadaṃ
ekenākārena

sandhi. ?? in one instance ✗

eko ekāya

idiom. (of a man and a woman) alone together; lit. one ✓

Grammar idiom, card + card
Meaning (of a man and a woman) alone together; lit. one
Commentary (VIN 1.3.1) eko ekāyā'ti bhikkhu c'eva hoti mātugāmo ca.
Sanskrit ekaḥ + ekayā

Examples

atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā kumārikā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā tassā kumārikāya saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṃkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesi kālayuttaṃ samullapanto kālayuttaṃ dhammaṃ bhaṇanto

VIN 1.3.1 paṭhamāniyata sikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṃkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappeyya

VIN PAT AN 1 paṭhamaaniyatasikkhāpadaṃ

Compound kammadhāraya (eka + udaka)
Sanskrit eka + udaka

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ayaṃ mahāpathavī ek'odakā assa. tatra puriso ekacchiggaḷaṃ yugaṃ pakkhipeyya.

Construction eka + odi
Synonym advaya, ekatta
Commentary (SNa) ekodi nipakā'ti ekaggacittā c'eva paññānepakkena ca samannāgatā.
Notes (PED) eka + odhi (CPD) eka + *ūti
Non IA eḵkam "sharpness, keeness" (Tamil)
Sanskrit ekavat, ekoti

Examples

tesaṃ pahānā ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ

kaṃ so sikkhaṃ samādāya,
ekodi nipako sato,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
ekodi hoti

idiom. unifies; unites; integrates; becomes one ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + pr
Meaning unifies; unites; integrates; becomes one
Variant ekodibhāvaṃ gacchati, ekodibhāvo hoti, ekodihoti, ekodī hoti, ekodibhoti

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yato kho bhikkhuno chasu phass'āyatanesu cittaṃ udujitaṃ hoti sudujitaṃ, ajjhattam'eva santiṭṭhati, sannisīdati, ekodi hoti, samādhiyati.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ taṃ cittaṃ ajjhattaṃ'y'eva santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati. so hoti samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhiladdho ekodibhāv'ādhigato na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
ekodikaroti

pr. integrates; unifies ✗
ekodibhāva

masc. singleness; integration; unification; lit. unified state [ekodi + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning singleness; integration; unification; lit. unified state
Construction ekodi + bhāva
Compound kammadhāraya (ekodi + bhāva)
Sanskrit ekavadbhāva

Examples

vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharissasi

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakk'āvasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāva-adhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
ekodibhāvādhigata

adj. become unified; acquired singleness [ekodibhāva + adhigata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning become unified; acquired singleness
Construction ekodibhāva + adhigata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (ekodibhāvaṃ + adhigata)
Sanskrit ekavadbhāva + adhigata

Example

tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate ath'āparaṃ dhammavitakk'āvasissati. so hoti samādhi na c'eva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāv'ādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato hoti.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
ekodibhāvita

adj. made unified; brought to integration ✗
ekodibhūta

adj. become unified; become integrated; become whole [ekodi + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning become unified; become integrated; become whole
Construction ekodi + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (ekodi + bhūta)
Sanskrit ekavat + bhūta

Example

etesu dhammesu vineyya chandaṃ,
bhikkhu satimā suvimuttacitto,
kālena so sammā dhammaṃ parivīmaṃsamāno,
ekodibhūto vihane tamaṃ so'ti.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
ekodibhoti

pr. unifies; becomes unified; becomes one [ekodi + bhoti] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning unifies; becomes unified; becomes one
Construction ekodi + bhoti
ekodihoti

pr. is or becomes integrated, unified; is apart ✗
ekodiṃ karoti

idiom. unifies; collects ✓

Grammar idiom, adj + pr
Meaning unifies; collects
Commentary (MNa) ekodiṃ karomī'ti ekaggaṃ karomi.
Sanskrit ekavat, ekoti + karoti

Examples

so kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ saṇṭhapemi sannisādemi ekodiṃ karomi samādahāmi. taṃ kissa hetu? mā me cittaṃ ūhaññī'ti.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ

mā, brāhmaṇa, paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ pamādo, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ saṇṭhapehi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ ekodiṃ karohi, paṭhame jhāne cittaṃ samādahā'ti.

SN 40.1 paṭhamajhānapañhāsuttaṃ
ekoyeva

sandhi. just one; only one [eko + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning just one; only one
Construction eko + [y] + eva
Phonetic Change +y
Sanskrit ekaḥ + eva

Example

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā pāsādasahassānaṃ eko'y'eva so pāsādo hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi, dhammo pāsādo.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
ekova

sandhi. alone; lit. just one [eko + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning alone; lit. just one
Construction eko + eva
Sanskrit eka + eva

Examples

eko'va bhagavā tasmiṃ samaye viharitu'kāmo hoti na bhagavā tasmiṃ samaye kenaci anubandhitabbo hotī'ti

SN 22.81 pālileyyasuttaṃ

eko'va indo asure jināti,
eko'va seno hanti dije pasayha,
eko'va byaggho migasaṅghapatto,
varaṃ varaṃ hanti balañ'hi t'ādisaṃ.

JA 492 tacchasūkara jātakaṃ
eja

adj. stirring [√ej] ✗
ejati

pr. moves; stirs [√ej] ✗
ejā

fem. impulse; movement; perturbance; (comm) craving [√ej + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from ejati
Meaning impulse; movement; perturbance; (comm) craving
Root Family √ej
Root √ej･1 a (move, shake)
Construction √ej + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Antonym āneñja
Commentary (SNPa) ejaṃ vossajjā'ti taṇhaṃ cajitvā
Sanskrit ejat
Sanskrit Root √ej 1 (stir)

Examples

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
dukkhaṃ iñjitapaccayā,
tasmā hi ejaṃ vossajja,
saṅkhāre uparundhiya,
anejo anupādāno,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 4
