purimaṃ pahāya aparaṃ sitāse,
ej'ānugā te na taranti saṅgaṃ,
te uggahāyanti nirassajanti,
kapī'va sākhaṃ pamuñcaṃ gahāyaṃ.

Examples

eṇijaṅgho kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ,
app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ'v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ,
kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma,
kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti

SN 1.30 eṇijaṅghasuttaṃ

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bank of the Eṇi river
Construction eṇi + kūla
Commentary (SNa) eṇikūlasmin'ti gaṅgātīre.

adj. with calves like an antelope; with haunches like a deer; eighth of the thirty-two marks of a great man [eṇi + jaṅghā + a] ✓

Meaning with calves like an antelope; with haunches like a deer; eighth of the thirty-two marks of a great man

eṇijaṅghasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.30 (SN1.30) ✗
eṇijaṅghā

fem. calf like an antelope [eṇi + jaṅghā] ~

Meaning calf like an antelope

eṇimiga

masc. kind of antelope ✗

varāhaeṇeyyavigāḷhasevite,
pabbhārakuṭṭe pakat'eva sundare,
nav'ambunā pāvusasitthakānane,
tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
eṇeyyaka

nt. name of a torture; lit. black antelope [eṇi + eyya + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, from eṇeyya
Meaning name of a torture; lit. black antelope
Construction eṇi + eyya + ka
eṇeyya + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (MNa) eṇeyyakan'ti eṇeyyakakammakāraṇaṃ. taṃ karontā ubhosu kapparesu ca jāṇūsu ca ayavalayāni datvā ayasūlāni koṭṭenti. so catūhi ayasūlehi bhūmiyaṃ patiṭṭhahati. atha naṃ parivāretvā aggiṃ karonti.
Sanskrit eṇa +

Example

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... cīrakavāsikam'pi karonti, eṇeyyakam'pi karonti, baḷisamaṃsikam'pi karonti, kahāpaṇikam'pi karonti, khārāpatacchikam'pi karonti, palighaparivattikam'pi karonti

eta

pron. this ✓

Grammar pron, base
Meaning this
Sanskrit etad

Examples

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

accenti kālā tarayanti rattiyo,
vayoguṇā anupubbaṃ jahanti,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

etageha

adj. having longings for this, desiring this ✗
etagocara

masc. this field; this domain [eta + gocara] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning this field; this domain

etaṅkāraṇa + ā

etañca

sandhi. and this [etaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning and this
Construction etaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit etam + ca

Examples

etañ'ca sallaṃ paṭikacca disvā,
ajjhositā yattha pajā visattā.
jānāmi passāmi tath'eva etaṃ,
ajjhositaṃ n'atthi tathāgatānan'ti.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ

etañ'ca dhammam'aññāya,
vicinaṃ bhikkhu sadā sato sikkhe,
santī'ti nibbutiṃ ñatvā,
sāsane gotamassa na pamajjeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
etañhi

sandhi. this truly; this indeed [etaṃ + hi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning this truly; this indeed
Construction etaṃ + hi
Sanskrit etam + hi

Examples

es'eva maggo n'atth'añño,
dassanassa visuddhiyā,
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha,
mārass'etaṃ pamohanaṃ.

DHP 274 maggavaggo

etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissatha,
akkhāto vo mayā maggo,
aññāya sallakantanaṃ.

DHP 275 maggavaggo
etato

pron. than this [eta + to] ~

Grammar pron, masc abl sg of eta
Meaning than this
Construction eta + to
Synonym etamhā, etasmā
Commentary (SNa) etato bhiyyo'ti etasmā sahassā atirekatarā.
etad

pron. this [eta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, in comps, nt acc sg of eta
Meaning this
Construction eta + aṃ > ad
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Synonym etaṃ
Notes archaic form of etaṃ found in compounds and idiom
Sanskrit etad

Examples

etad'aññāya ye satā,
diṭṭhadhamm'ābhinibbutā,
na te māravas'ānugā,
na te mārassa paddhagū'ti.

SNP 65 kappa māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 10

etad'aggaṃ paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṃ paññapentānaṃ yad'idaṃ channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca assādañ'ca.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
etadagga

adj. this is the best; this is the highest [etad + agga] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning this is the best; this is the highest
Construction etad + agga
Commentary (ANa) etadaggan'ti etaṃ aggaṃ.
etadaggavagga 1

masc. Chapter on "This is the Number One" ✗
etadaggavagga 2

masc. Chapter 14 of Ekakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 1.188-197 ✗
etadaggaṃ

sandhi. (+gen) this is the greatest (of); this is the best (of); this is the highest (of) [etad + aggaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adj (+gen)
Meaning this is the greatest (of); this is the best (of); this is the highest (of)
Construction etad + aggaṃ
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Commentary (VIN 1.2.4) etadaggan'ti etaṃ aggaṃ etaṃ seṭṭhaṃ etaṃ mokkhaṃ etaṃ uttamaṃ etaṃ pavaraṃ.
Sanskrit etad + agra

Examples

etadaggaṃ bhagini pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ etena dhammena paricareyyā'ti methun'upasaṃhitena, saṅghādiseso.

VIN PAT SA 4 attakāmapāricariyasikkhāpadaṃ

etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dasannaṃ kasiṇ'āyatanānaṃ yadidaṃ viññāṇakasiṇaṃ eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ. evaṃsaññino'pi kho, bhikkhave, santi sattā.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
etadaññāya

sandhi. understanding this [etad + aññāya] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ger
Meaning understanding this
Construction etad + aññāya
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit etam + ājñāya

Examples

ye etadaññāya padaṃ asaṅkhataṃ,
vimuttacittā bhavanettisaṅkhayā,
te dhammasār'ādhigamā khaye ratā,
pahaṃsu te sabbabhavāni tādino'ti.

ITI 44 nibbānadhātusuttaṃ

aññāt'atthaṃ pasād'atthaṃ,
sataṃ ve hoti mantanā,
evaṃ kho ariyā mantenti,
esā ariyāna mantanā,
etadaññāya medhāvī,
na samusseyya mantaye'ti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
etadattha 1

Sanskrit etad + artha

Examples

etadatthā, bhikkhave, kathā, etadatthā mantanā, etadatthā upanisā, etadatthaṃ sot'āvadhānaṃ, yadidaṃ anupādā cittassa vimokkho'ti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

akuppā cetovimutti etadattham'idaṃ brāhmaṇa brahmacariyaṃ

MN 29 mahāsāropamasuttaṃ

sāvatthinidānaṃ. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi.

SN 1.13 natthiputtasamasuttaṃ
etadatthā

sandhi. this is the purpose of; lit. this goals ✗
etadatthiya

adj. having this purpose; useful for this ✗
etadantika

adj. having this as an end, having an end here; ending thus ✗

Meaning authorizes that (for); appoints that (to)

Meaning one said this (to)
Construction etad + abravi
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit etad + bravīti

Example

taṃ tathāvādiniṃ buddho,
mamaṃ so etadabravi,
na h'evaṃ vandiyā buddhā,
yathā vandasi gotamī.

API 17 mahāpajāpatigotamītherīapadānaṃ
etadabravuṃ

Grammar aor 3rd pl of etadabravi, comp vb
Meaning they said this
Construction etad + abravuṃ
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit etad + bruvanti

Example

tassa taṃ vacanaṃ sutvā,
abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ,
satthāni nikkhipitvāna,

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā
etadavaca

imperf. said this [etad + avaca] ✓

Grammar imperf, comp vb
Meaning said this
Construction etad + avaca
Synonym etadavoca
Sanskrit etad + avaca

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, catasso komāriyo pajāpatiyo ahesuṃ. atha khvāhaṃ, bhante, yena tā pajāpatiyo tenupasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā tā pajāpatiyo etadavacaṃ, mayā kho, bhaginiyo, brahmacariyapañcamāni sikkhāpadāni samādinnāni. yā icchati sā idh'eva bhoge ca bhuñjatu puññāni ca karotu, sakāni vā ñātikulāni gacchatu.

AN 8.21 paṭhamauggasuttaṃ
etadavoca

aor. said this [etad + avoca] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning said this
Construction etad + avoca
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Compound comp verb (etad + avoca)
Sanskrit etad + avak

Examples

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

idh'āhaṃ, bhante, yen'aññataro bhikkhu ten'upasaṅkamiṃ, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocaṃ, kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti?

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
etadahosi

sandhi. (+dat) this (thought) occurred (to); lit. this was (for) [etad + ahosi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + aor (+dat)
Meaning this (thought) occurred (to); lit. this was (for)
Construction etad + ahosi
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit etad + abhavat

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ āvuso, etadahosi, idha bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

SN 21.1 kolitasuttaṃ

atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ. yaṃnūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten'upasaṅkameyyāmā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
etadānuttariya

nt. (+gen) this is the highest; this is the ultimate [etad + ānuttariya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp (+gen)
Meaning this is the highest; this is the ultimate
Construction etad + ānuttariya
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Compound kammadhāraya (etad + ānuttariya)
Sanskrit etad + anuttara +

Example

etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

AN 10.22 adhivuttipadasuttaṃ
etadeva

sandhi. just this; only this; this exact [etad + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just this; only this; this exact
Construction etad + eva
Phonetic Change ṃ > d (Kacc 34, 52)
Sanskrit etad + eva

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubb'upagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya yassa sambādho bhavissati, so pakkamissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 16 dutiyasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

etadeva, bhante, bahutaraṃ yadidaṃ mahāpathavī. appamattakoyaṃ bhagavatā paritto nakhasikhāyaṃ paṃsu āropito.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
etadohi

ind. this as limit; to this limit, as far as this ✗
etapatha

masc. this path; this way [eta + patha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning this path; this way
Construction eta + patha
etaparama 1

adj. same size; this size at the most; lit. this at most [eta + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning same size; this size at the most; lit. this at most
Construction eta + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (eta + parama)
Commentary (MNa) etaparamo'ti etaṃ pamāṇaṃ paramaṃ assā'ti etaparamo.
Sanskrit eta + parama

Example

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, ekaṃ'y'eva kolaṃ āhāraṃ āhāritā. siyā kho pana te, sāriputta, evam'assa, mahā nūna tena samayena kolo ahosī'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, sāriputta, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. tadā'pi etaparamo'y'eva kolo ahosi seyyathā'pi etarahi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
etaparama 2

adj. this degree at the most ✗
etaparamaṃ 1

ind. to such a degree at the most; to a maximum of this level; this much at most; lit. this at most [eta + parama + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of etaparama
Meaning to such a degree at the most; to a maximum of this level; this much at most; lit. this at most
Construction eta + parama + aṃ
etaparama + aṃ
Sanskrit eta + paramaṃ

Example

ye'pi te, bho gotama, ahesuṃ atītamaddhānaṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā te'pi bhagavanto etaparamaṃ'y'eva sammā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṭipādesuṃ, seyyathā'pi etarahi bhotā gotamena sammā bhikkhusaṅgho paṭipādito.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
etaparamaṃ 2

ind. as well as, only as well as, on as much as ✗
etapparama 1

adj. such a distinguished; such an excellent; lit. this at most [etad + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning such a distinguished; such an excellent; lit. this at most
Construction etad + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (eta + parama)
Variant etaparama
Sanskrit eta + parama

Example

ye hi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ atītam'addhānaṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesam'pi bhagavantānaṃ etapparamaṃ'y'eva sāvakayugaṃ ahosi, seyyathā'pi mayhaṃ sāriputtamoggallānā.

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ
etapparama 2

adj. this is the highest; this is the ultimate; lit. this most [etad + parama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning this is the highest; this is the ultimate; lit. this most
Construction etad + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (eta + parama)
Variant etaṃparama
Sanskrit eta + parama
etamatthaṃ 1

sandhi. meaning of this; significance of this [etaṃ + atthaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc
Meaning meaning of this; significance of this
Construction etaṃ + atthaṃ
Sanskrit etam + artham

Examples

atha kho bhagavā etam'atthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

evaṃsampadam'idaṃ āyasmantānaṃ satthari sammukhībhūte, taṃ bhagavantaṃ atisitvā, amhe etam'atthaṃ paṭipucchitabbaṃ maññatha.

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
etamatthaṃ 2

sandhi. this matter; this case; this affair [etaṃ + atthaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc
Meaning this matter; this case; this affair
Construction etaṃ + atthaṃ
Sanskrit etam + artham

Examples

idāni pana, bhagavatā paṭikkhittan'ti kukkuccāyantā na viññāpema, tena no na phāsu hotī'ti. bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

VIN 2.7.4 sakkaccavaggo

kathaṃ nu kho amhehi paṭipajjitabban'ti? bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

VIN 5.4.7 tiṇavatthārakaṃ
etamabhijānāti

pr. knows this; understand this; comprehends this [etaṃ + abhijānāti] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning knows this; understand this; comprehends this
Construction etaṃ + abhijānāti
etamahaṃ

sandhi. I (seeing) this [etaṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning I (seeing) this
Construction etaṃ + ahaṃ
Sanskrit etam + aham

Examples

etam'ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, parisuddhakāyakammataṃ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomam'āpādiṃ araññe vihārāya.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

tatra vata maṃ bhayaṃ vā sārajjaṃ vā okkamissatī'ti nimittam'etaṃ, sāriputta, na samanupassāmi. etam'ahaṃ, sāriputta, nimittaṃ asamanupassanto khemappatto abhayappatto vesārajjappatto viharāmi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
etamādīnava

sandhi. this danger; this disadvantage; this risk; this peril [etaṃ + ādīnava] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc
Meaning this danger; this disadvantage; this risk; this peril
Construction etaṃ + ādīnava
Sanskrit etam + ādīnava

Example

etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā,
taṇhaṃ dukkhassa sambhavaṃ,
vītataṇho anādāno,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
etampi

sandhi. just this; this alone; this [etaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just this; this alone; this
Construction etaṃ + api
Sanskrit etad + api

Examples

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

yā uṇṇatī s'āssa vighātabhūmi,
mān'ātimānaṃ vadate pan'eso,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
etamhā

pron. from this [eta + mhā] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt abl sg of eta
Meaning from this
Construction eta + mhā
Synonym etato, etasmā
Sanskrit etāt

Example

nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi, iṅgha me tvaṃ, ānanda, etamhā udapānā pānīyaṃ āharā'ti.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
etarahi

ind. now; at present; lit. this day [eta + ahi] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning now; at present; lit. this day
Construction eta + [r] + ahi
Phonetic Change +r
Antonym pubbe
Synonym idāni
Sanskrit etarhi

Examples

pubbe c'āhaṃ anurādha eta'r'ahi ca dukkhañ'c'eva paññapemi dukkhassa ca nirodhan'ti

SN 22.86 anurādhasuttaṃ

ye'pi hi keci, rāhula, eta'r'ahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kāyakammaṃ parisodhenti … sabbe te evam'evaṃ paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā kāyakammaṃ parisodhenti

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
etasmā 1

pron. from this [eta + smā] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt abl sg of eta
Meaning from this
Construction eta + smā
Synonym etato, etamhā
Sanskrit etāt

Examples

atha kho te'pi bhikkhū ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetu'kāmā samanuyuñjanti samanugāhanti samanubhāsanti

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

yato kho te bhikkhū n'āsakkhiṃsu āyasmantaṃ yamakaṃ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetuṃ

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
etasmā 2

pron. than this [eta + smā] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt abl sg of eta
Meaning than this
Construction eta + smā
Synonym etato, etamhā
Sanskrit etāt

Example

etadānuttariyaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇānaṃ yadidaṃ tattha tattha yathābhūtañāṇaṃ. etasmā c'āhaṃ, ānanda, ñāṇā aññaṃ ñāṇaṃ uttaritaraṃ vā paṇītataraṃ vā n'atthī'ti vadāmi.

AN 10.22 adhivuttipadasuttaṃ
etasmiṃ

pron. in this; in this person [eta + asmiṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, loc sg of eta
Meaning in this; in this person
Construction eta + asmiṃ
Sanskrit etasmin

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno evaṃ vadeyya, na tāv'āhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi, yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchāmī'ti, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 71 sahadhammikasikkhāpadaṃ

etasmiṃ yaṃ vijjati antare dhanaṃ,
muttā maṇi veḷuriyañ'ca bhaddakaṃ,
siṅgīsuvaṇṇaṃ atha vā'pi kañcanaṃ,
yaṃ jātarūpaṃ haṭakan'ti vuccati.

AN 8.45 bojjhasuttaṃ
etassa 1

pron. for this; to him [eta + ssa] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt dat sg of eta
Meaning for this; to him
Construction eta + ssa
Sanskrit etasya

Examples

etassa bhagavā kālo, etassa sugata kālo, yaṃ bhagavā dhammaṃ deseyya.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

rājā'pi amacce pakkosāpetvā, mayhaṃ bhāgineyyo'pi imassa rajjassa sāmiko'va, dhītaraṃ etassa-eva datvā abhisekam'assa karomī'ti.

JAa 126 asilakkhaṇajātakavaṇṇanā
etassa 2

pron. of this [eta + ssa] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen sg of eta
Meaning of this
Construction eta + ssa
Sanskrit etasya

Examples

dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, āvuso, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa atthamaññātuṃ

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
etassa bhagavā kālo

idiom. it’s the right time for this, Blessed One!; now is the time, Blessed One! ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + masc + masc
Meaning it’s the right time for this, Blessed One!; now is the time, Blessed One!

Examples

etassa bhagavā kālo, etassa sugata kālo, yaṃ bhagavā dhammaṃ deseyya.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

etassa, bhagavā, kālo, etassa, sugata, kālo, yaṃ bhagavā saddhassa saddh'āpadānāni bhāseyya.

AN 11.14 subhūtisuttaṃ
etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ

idiom. the meaning of this statement ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + nt + masc
Meaning the meaning of this statement

Example

atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ n'eva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamiṃsu, bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
etasseva

sandhi. of this very; of this exact [etassa + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning of this very; of this exact
Construction etassa + eva
Sanskrit etasya + eva

Example

sādhu sādhu, āvuso yamaka! tena h'āvuso, yamaka, upamaṃ te karissāmi etass'eva atthassa bhiyyosomattāya ñāṇāya.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
etaṃ 1

pron. this; this thing (subject) [eta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, nt nom sg of eta
Meaning this; this thing (subject)
Construction eta + aṃ
Synonym etad, enaṃ, ese
Sanskrit etam

Examples

anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

DHP 185 buddhavaggo

daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. tasmā't'iha vo, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, kāyagatā no sati bhāvitā bhavissati bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
etaṃ 2

pron. this; this man; this thing (object) [eta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc fem and nt acc sg of eta
Meaning this; this man; this thing (object)
Construction eta + aṃ
Sanskrit etam

Examples

paññā c'eva sati yañ'ca
nāmarūpañ'ca mārisa,
etaṃ me puṭṭho pabrūhi,
katth'etaṃ uparujjhati.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

evamesā kasī kaṭṭhā,
sā hoti amatapphalā,
etaṃ kasiṃ kasitvāna,
sabbadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4

etādisa

adj. of this kind; of this type; such as this [eta + ādisa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of this kind; of this type; such as this
Construction eta + ādisa
Antonym netādisa
Sanskrit etādṛśa

Examples

et'ādisāni katvāna,
sabbatthamaparājitā,
sabbattha sotthiṃ gacchanti,
taṃ tesaṃ maṅgalam'uttaman'ti.

KHP 5 maṅgalasuttaṃ

yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
et'ādiso vinābhāvo,
passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.

SNP 34 sallasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 8
etādisikā

adj. such (a), of such a kind ✗
etāni 1

pron. these [eta + āni] ✓

Grammar pron, nt nom pl of eta
Meaning these
Construction eta + āni
Sanskrit etāni

Examples

etāni, cunda, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni, jhāyatha, cunda, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchāvippaṭisārino ahuvattha, ayaṃ kho amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

ye puggalā aṭṭha sataṃ pasatthā,
cattāri etāni yugāni honti,
te dakkhiṇeyyā sugatassa sāvakā,
etesu dinnāni mahapphalāni,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
etāni 2

pron. these; these things (object) [eta] ✗
etāya 1

pron. (gram) after this [eta + āya] ✓

Grammar pron, fem abl sg of eta
Meaning (gram) after this
Construction eta + āya
Sanskrit etāyāḥ

Examples

asa'icc'etāya dhātuyā mi ma'icc'etesaṃ vibhattīnaṃ mhi mh'ādesā honti vā, dhātv'antassa lopo ca. amhi, amha, asmi, asma.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 492

asa'icc'etāya dhātuyā thassa vibhattissa tthattaṃ hoti, dhātv'antassa lopo ca. attha.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 493
etāya 2

pron. by her; with this [eta] ✗
etāya 3

pron. to her; for this [eta] ✗
etāya 4

pron. hers; of this [eta] ✗
etāva

adj. so great, of such extent ✗
etāvataparama

adj. having such as its highest limit; i.e. only as good as such, only so great ✗
etāvataparamaṃ

ind. only to such an extent, only as greatly ✗
etāvant

adj. so great, of such extent ✗
etāvaparama

adj. this much at most; such at best; equal at best [etāvant + parama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning this much at most; such at best; equal at best
Construction etāvant + parama
Compound kammadhāraya (etāvant + parama)
Commentary (SNa) so etāvaparamo siyā, na therena uttaritaro nāma atthī'ti vadati. (MNa) etāva paraman'ti tāsam'pi vedanānam'etaṃ'y'eva paramaṃ, uttamaṃ pamāṇaṃ.
Sanskrit etāvat + parama

Examples

sāriputto'va paññāya,
sīlena upasamena ca,
yo'pi pāraṅgato bhikkhu,
etāvaparamo siyā'ti.

SN 1.48 jetavanasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, ye kho keci atītam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā opakkamikā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayiṃsu, etāvaparamaṃ, na'y'ito bhiyyo.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
eti 1

pr. (+acc) comes (to) [√i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning comes (to)
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction e + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym neti
Sanskrit eti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

ehi sārathi gacchāhi,
rathaṃ niyyādayāh'imaṃ,
ārogyaṃ brāhmaṇiṃ vajja,
pabbaji dāni brāhmaṇo,
sujāto tīhi rattīhi,
tisso vijjā aphassayi.

THI 69 sundarītherīgāthā

sace enti manussattaṃ,
dalidde jāyare kule,
coḷaṃ piṇḍo ratī khiḍḍā,
yattha kicchena labbhati.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
eti 2

pr. (+acc) goes (to); becomes [√i + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning goes (to); becomes
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction e + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym neti
Sanskrit eti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

na pupphagandho paṭivātam'eti,
na candanaṃ tagaramallikā,
satañ'ca gandho paṭivātam'eti,
sabbā disā sappuriso pavāyati.

DHP 54 pupphavaggo

ete ca ñatvā upanissitā'ti,
ñatvā munī nissaye so vimaṃsī,
ñatvā vimutto na vivādam'eti,
bhav'ābhavāya na sameti dhīro'ti.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
etissā 1

pron. to her; for this [eta] ✗
etissā 2

pron. of this; of her [eta + issā] ✓

Grammar pron, fem gen sg of eta
Meaning of this; of her
Construction eta + issā
Sanskrit etasyāḥ

Examples

tatra, bhikkhave, y'āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā taṃ nissāya taṃ āgamma y'āyaṃ upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā taṃ pajahatha, taṃ samatikkamatha. evam'etissā pahānaṃ hoti, evam'etissā samatikkamo hoti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yathā kathaṃ pana kho, kosiya, bhagavā saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ abhāsi? sādhu mayam'pi etissā kathāya bhāgino assāma savanāyā'ti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
etu

imp. come!; please come!; let one come! [√i + a + tu] ✓

Grammar imp of eti, intrans
Meaning come!; please come!; let one come!
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction e + tu
Phonetic Change i > e
Antonym netu
Sanskrit etu
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

etu kho, bhante, bhagavā. svāgataṃ, bhante, bhagavato. cirassaṃ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṃ pariyāyam'akāsi, yadidaṃ idh'āgamanāya. nisīdatu, bhante, bhagavā, idaṃ āsanaṃ paññattan'ti.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu

addasā kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantañ'ca revataṃ āyasmantañ'ca ānandaṃ dūrato'va āgacchante. disvāna āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca, etu kho āyasmā ānando!

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
ete 1

pron. these; these people; these things [eta + e] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt nom pl of eta
Meaning these; these people; these things
Construction eta + e
Antonym nete
Sanskrit etāḥ, etāni

Examples

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

yathā ahaṃ tathā ete,
yathā ete tathā ahaṃ,
attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā,
na haneyya na ghātaye.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
ete 2

pron. these; these people; these things (object) [eta + e] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt acc pl
Meaning these; these people; these things (object)
Construction eta + e
Sanskrit etān, etāni

Example

ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabb'ete pañc'upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ
etena

ind. because of this; on account of this; lit. by this; with this [eta + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, instr sg of eta
Meaning because of this; on account of this; lit. by this; with this
Construction eta + ena
Synonym idappaccayā
Sanskrit etena

Examples

anāgatappajappāya,
atītass'ānusocanā,
etena bālā sussanti,
naḷo'va harito luto'ti.

SN 1.10 araññasuttaṃ

paññāyissasi kho tvaṃ, moghapurisa, etena sakena pāpakena diṭṭhigatena. idh'āhaṃ bhikkhū paṭipucchissāmī'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
etena upāyena

idiom. in this way, thus; by this means ✗
etenupāyena

sandhi. by this means; through this method [etena + upāyena] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc
Meaning by this means; through this method
Construction etena + upāyena
eteneva

sandhi. with exactly this; by just this; with this alone [etena + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning with exactly this; by just this; with this alone
Construction etena + eva
Sanskrit etena + eva

Example

evaṃ taṃ puggalaṃ karuṇāyitvā tato paraṃ eten'eva upāyena piyapuggale, tato majjhatte, tato verimhī'ti anukkamena karuṇā pavattetabbā.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā
eteyeva

sandhi. these just [ete + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning these just
Construction ete + eva
Sanskrit etāḥ + eva

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussesu paccājāyanti. atha kho ete'y'eva bahutarā sattā ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ
etesaṃ 1

pron. for them; for these [eta] ✗
etesaṃ 2

pron. of them; of these [eta + esānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen pl of eta
Meaning of them; of these
Construction eta + esānaṃ > esaṃ
Synonym etesānaṃ
Sanskrit etānām

Examples

āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca, yo hi koci, āvuso, paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, sabbo so pañcahi ṭhānehi, etesaṃ vā aññatarena

AN 5.165 pañhapucchāsuttaṃ

evam'etesaṃ, bhikkhave, suttantānaṃ tathāgatabhāsitānaṃ gambhīrānaṃ gambhīr'atthānaṃ lok'uttarānaṃ suññatappaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ antaradhānaṃ bhavissati.

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ
etesu

pron. in these; among these [eta + esu] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt loc pl of eta
Meaning in these; among these
Construction eta + esu
Sanskrit eteṣu

Examples

yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi,
uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'cā'pi majjhe,
etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca,
panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4

ete vivādā samaṇesu jātā,
etesu ugghāti nighāti hoti,
etam'pi disvā virame kath'ojjaṃ,
na h'añña'd'atth'atthi pasaṃsalābhā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
etehi 1

pron. by these; with these [eta + ehi] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt instr pl of eta
Meaning by these; with these
Construction eta + ehi
Sanskrit etaiḥ

Examples

saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyya,
dajjā appam'pi yācito,
etehi tīhi ṭhānehi,
gacche devāna santike.

DHP 224 kodhavaggo

taṃ kissa hetu? līnaṃ, bhikkhave, cittaṃ taṃ etehi dhammehi dussamuṭṭhāpayaṃ hoti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
etehi 2

pron. from these; from them [eta] ✗
etta 1.1

adj. so much; this much [ima + tta] ✓

Grammar adj, from ima
Meaning so much; this much
Construction ima + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym ettaka
Sanskrit etāvat

Example

te t'ādise pūjayato,
nibbute akutobhaye,
na sakkā puññaṃ saṅkhātuṃ,
im'ettam'api kenaci.

DHP 196 buddhavaggo
etta 2.1

nt. (gram) letter e; 7th letter of the alphabet; gutturo-palatal vowel; lit. "e" state [e + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, letter, abstr, from e
Meaning (gram) letter e; 7th letter of the alphabet; gutturo-palatal vowel; lit. "e" state
Construction e + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym ekāra
Sanskrit e

Example

akārapaccayo lopam'āpajjate, ettañ'ca hoti vā. vajjemi, vademi, vajjāmi, vadāmi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 510
ettaka

adj. so much; this much; so long [ima + tta + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from etta
Meaning so much; this much; so long
Construction ima + tta + ka
etta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym etta
Sanskrit etāvat

Examples

atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

no ca khv'assa evaṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti, ettakaṃ vata me ajja vāsijaṭassa khīṇaṃ, ettakaṃ hiyyo, ettakaṃ pare'ti. atha khv'assa khīṇe khīṇan'tv'eva ñāṇaṃ hoti.

SN 22.101 vāsijaṭasuttaṃ
ettakaparama

adj. only so much; this much at the most ✗
ettakavaṇṇa

adj. limited to this much praise ✗
ettakaṃ

ind. so much; so long ✗
ettakena

ind. by so much; to such an extent ✗
ettakopi

sandhi. even so much; just this much [ettako + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning even so much; just this much
Construction ettako + api
Sanskrit etāvat + api

Example

atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ gomayapiṇḍaṃ pāṇinā gahetvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca. ettako'pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n'atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath'eva ṭhassati.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
ettāvataggaṃ

sandhi. such is the highest; this far is the ultimate [ettāvatā + aggaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + adj
Meaning such is the highest; this far is the ultimate
Construction ettāvatā + aggaṃ
Commentary (SNa) ettāvat'aggam'pi vadanti h'eke'ti eke sassatavādā samaṇabrāhmaṇā paṇḍitamānino ettāvatā'pi aggaṃ suddhiṃ vadanti.
Sanskrit etāvat + agra

Example

yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
ettāvat'aggaṃ nu vadanti h'eke,
yakkhassa suddhiṃ idha paṇḍitāse,
udāhu aññam'pi vadanti etto.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
ettāvatā

ind. to this extent; to such a degree; so far [ima + tāva + tā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, from ettāva
Meaning to this extent; to such a degree; so far
Construction ima + tāva + tā
ettāva + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit etāvattva

Examples

ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhu abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānāti, pariññeyyaṃ parijānāti, abhiññeyyaṃ abhijānanto pariññeyyaṃ parijānanto diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hotī'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
ettāvatāpi

sandhi. even just this much; even to this extent; even just so far [ettāvatā + pi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning even just this much; even to this extent; even just so far
Construction ettāvatā + pi
Sanskrit etāvat + api

Examples

tassa ce, āvuso, bhikkhuno evaṃ buddhaṃ anussarato, evaṃ dhammaṃ anussarato, evaṃ saṅghaṃ anussarato upekkhā kusalanissitā saṇṭhāti, so tena attamano hoti. ettāvatā'pi kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno bahukataṃ hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

yato kho, āvuso, ariyasāvako akusalañ'ca pajānāti akusalamūlañ'ca pajānāti kusalañ'ca pajānāti kusalamūlañ'ca pajānāti ettāvatā'pi kho āvuso ariyasāvako sammādiṭṭhi hoti

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
ettāvant

adj. such; so great; so excellent; lit. having this quality [ima + tta + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from etta
Meaning such; so great; so excellent; lit. having this quality
Construction ima + tta + vant
etta + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Commentary (SNa) so etāvaparamo siyā, na therena uttaritaro nāma atthī'ti vadati.
Sanskrit etāvat

Example

sāriputto'va paññāya,
sīlena upasamena ca,
yo'pi pāraṅgato bhikkhu,
etāvaparamo siyā'ti.

SN 1.48 jetavanasuttaṃ

aṭṭhakavaggo 11

kakkaṭako āha, mātula, ayaṃ saro etto, tvaṃ pana ito kiṃ nesī'ti?

JAa 38 bakajātakavaṇṇanā
ettha 1

Construction ima + ttha

Sanskrit atra

yam'etaṃ pañhaṃ apucchi,
ajita taṃ vadāmi te,
yattha nāmañ'ca rūpañ'ca,
asesaṃ uparujjhati,
viññāṇassa nirodhena,
etth'etaṃ uparujjhati.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ

Meaning now in this regard; here this
Construction ettha + ayaṃ
Sanskrit atra + ayam

rāgo uppatho akkhāto,
vayo rattin'divakkhayo,
itthī malaṃ brahmacariyassa,
etth'āyaṃ sajjate pajā,
tapo ca brahmacariyañ'ca,
taṃ sinānam'anodakan'ti.

micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammājīvena jīvitaṃ kappeti, etth'ete akusalā sīlā aparisesā nirujjhanti

DN 3.7 ambaṭṭhasuttaṃ

mutto bandhanam'eva dhāvati.

Commentary (THa) edisan'ti evarūpaṃ
Sanskrit īdṛśa

aggiṃ pajjalitaṃ va liṅgiya,

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā

evarūpe mahabbhaye'ti edise mahati maraṇabhaye upaṭṭhite. hetuatthe vā etaṃ bhummavacanaṃ.

THa 248 adhimuttattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
edisaka

adj. such; like this; something like this [eta + ādisa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning such; like this; something like this
Construction eta > e + ādisa + ka
edisa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change eta > a (contraction)
Commentary (THIa) na puno edisakaṃ bhavissatī'ti ito paraṃ evarūpaṃ anācāracaraṇaṃ na bhavissati, na karissāmī'ti attho.
Sanskrit īdṛśaka

Example

tassa ca viramāsi tāva'd'e,
rāgo tattha khamāpayī ca naṃ,
sotthi siyā brahmacārinī,
na puno edisakaṃ bhavissati.

ena

pron. him, her, it (referring to someone or something already mentioned); this, that; this one ✗
enaṃ

pron. him; her; this one [eta + aṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc fem and nt acc sg of eta
Meaning him; her; this one
Construction eta > ena + aṃ
Sanskrit etam

Examples

yatv'ādhikaraṇam'enaṃ cakkhu'ndriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

abalā naṃ balīyanti,
maddant'enaṃ parissayā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
nāvaṃ bhinnam'iv'odakaṃ.

SNP 39 kāmasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 1
enījaṅgha

adj. with legs like the black antelope's (one of the 32 characteristics of a great man) ✗
enta

prp. coming [√i] ✗
em

ind. so; in this way ✗
eyya 1.1

opt. (+acc) would go (to); should come [√i + ayya] ✓

Grammar opt of eti, trans (+acc)
Meaning would go (to); should come
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction e + eyya
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit eyāt
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

yā kācimā sammutiyo puthujjā,
sabbāva etā na upeti vidvā,
anūpayo so upayaṃ kim'eyya,
diṭṭhe sute khantim'akubbamāno.

SNP 51 mahābyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 13

gacch'āvuso aham'pi āgacchāmī'ti. eyyāsi bhante pur'āhaṃ haññāmī'ti

VIN 1.1.2 dutiya pārājikaṃ
eyya 2.1

ve. (+acc) (gram) eyya; verbal ending of the optative 3rd person singular ✓

Grammar ve, masc, trans (+acc)
Meaning (gram) eyya; verbal ending of the optative 3rd person singular
Sanskrit yāt

Examples

508, 515. eyyassa ñāto iyā ñā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 508

eyyassa vibhattissa ñā'icc'etāya dhātuyā parassa iyā ñā ādesā honti vā. jāniyā, jaññā. vā'ti kim'atthaṃ? jāneyya.

erakavattika

nt. name of a torture; lit. grass twist [eraka + vattika] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a torture; lit. grass twist
Construction eraka + vattika
Compound kammadhāraya (eraka + vattika)
Commentary (MNa) erakavattikan'ti erakavattakammakāraṇaṃ, taṃ karontā gīvato paṭṭhāya cammabaddhe kantitvā gopphake ṭhapenti. atha naṃ yottehi bandhitvā kaḍḍhanti. so attano cammabaddhe akkamitvā akkamitvā patati.
Sanskrit erakā + vartaka

Example

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... bilaṅgathālikam'pi karonti, saṅkhamuṇḍikam'pi karonti, rāhumukham'pi karonti, jotimālikam'pi karonti, hatthapajjotikam'pi karonti, erakavattikam'pi karonti

Example

sace hi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cattāri ahirājakulāni mettena cittena phareyya, na hi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ahinā daṭṭho kālaṅ'kareyya. katamāni cattāri? virūp'akkhaṃ ahirājakulaṃ, erāpathaṃ ahirājakulaṃ, chabyāputtaṃ ahirājakulaṃ, kaṇhāgotamakaṃ ahirājakulaṃ.

erita

pp. moved; stirred; shaken; swayed; agitated; whipped up; lit. caused to move [√īr + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of ereti, caus
Meaning moved; stirred; shaken; swayed; agitated; whipped up; lit. caused to move
Root Family √īr
Root √īr･1 *e (move, shake)
Base √īr + *e > ere (caus)
Construction ere + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Phonetic Change ī > e
Synonym kampita, calita, byāthita, mathita, saṃvejita
Commentary (THIa) mālut'eritā'ti vātena sañcalitā
Sanskrit īrita
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto vāt'erito calito bhanto ūmijāto. tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya.

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ

kusumitasikharā ca pādapā,
abhigajjant'iva mālut'eritā,
kā tuyhaṃ rati bhavissati,
yadi ekā vanam'ogahissasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
ereti 1

pr. (+acc) agitates; arouses; lit. causes to move [√īr + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of īrati, trans (+acc)
Meaning agitates; arouses; lit. causes to move
Root Family √īr
Root √īr･1 *e (move, shake)
Base √īr + *e > ere (caus)
Construction ere + ti
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym nereti
Sanskrit īrayati
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)

Example

sace na-eresi attānaṃ,
kaṃso upahato yathā,
esa patto'si nibbānaṃ,
sārambho te na vijjati.

DHP 134 daṇḍavaggo
ereti 2

pr. (+acc) moves; shakes; rustles; lit. causes to move [√īr + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of īrati, trans (+acc)
Meaning moves; shakes; rustles; lit. causes to move
Root Family √īr
Root √īr･1 *e (move, shake)
Base √īr + *e > ere (caus)
Construction ere + ti
Phonetic Change ī > e
Antonym nereti
Synonym samiñjati, samīrati
Commentary (MNa) vāto vā paṇṇakasaṭaṃ eretī'ti vāto vā paṇṇakacavaraṃ ghaṭṭeti.
Sanskrit īrayati
Sanskrit Root √īr 1, 2 (set in motion)

Example

tattha ca me, brāhmaṇa, viharato mago vā āgacchati, moro vā kaṭṭhaṃ pāteti, vāto vā paṇṇakasaṭaṃ ereti.

aor. shook, set into motion [√īr] ✗

Meaning dripping with saliva

elaṇḍa

masc. castor-oil plant ✗
elamūga

masc. drooling fool; drivelling idiot; lit. drool dumb [elā + mūga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning drooling fool; drivelling idiot; lit. drool dumb
Construction elā + mūga
Compound kammadhāraya (elā + mūga)
Antonym anelamūga
Variant eḷamūga
Commentary (MNa) eḷamūgā'ti elamukhā, kha-kārassa ga-kāro kato. lālamukhā'ti vuttaṃ hoti. duppaññānañ'hi kathentānaṃ lālā mukhato galati, lālā ca elā'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit eḍamūka (bsk)

Example

catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu n'ālaṃ araññavanappatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevituṃ. katamehi catūhi? kāmavitakkena, byāpādavitakkena, vihiṃsāvitakkena, duppañño hoti jaḷo elamūgo

AN 4.262 araññasuttaṃ
elā 1

fem. spittle; saliva; drool ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning spittle; saliva; drool
Synonym lālā
Variant eḷā
Commentary (ANa) yesaṃ eḷā mukhato na galati, te aneḷamūgā nāma, aneḷamukhā niddosamukhā'ti attho.
Sanskrit lālā

Example

nekkhammavitakkena, abyāpādavitakkena, avihiṃsāvitakkena, paññavā hoti ajaḷo anelamūgo, imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃ araññavanappatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevitun'ti.

Meaning only; just; merely; exclusively

Sanskrit eva

Examples

DHPa 1.5.9 sumanamālākāra vatthu

saddhāya sīlena ca yā'dha vaḍḍhati,
paññāya cāgena sutena c'ūbhayaṃ,
sā t'ādisī sīlavatī upāsikā,
ādīyati sāram'idh'eva attano'ti.

SN 37.34 vaḍḍhīsuttaṃ
eva 2

ind. still ✓

Grammar ind
Meaning still
Sanskrit eva

Example

siyā kho pana te, nigrodha, evam'assa, antevāsikamyatā no samaṇo gotamo evam'āhā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ, nigrodha, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. yo eva vo ācariyo, so eva vo ācariyo hotu.

DN 25 udumbarikasuttaṃ
eva 3

ind. even; too; as well ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning even; too; as well
Synonym api
Sanskrit eva

Examples

mettaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca.

tassa kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca kulāni ca tena duṭṭhāni dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca

evañca

sandhi. and thus; and like this; but like this [evaṃ + ca] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning and thus; and like this; but like this
Construction evaṃ + ca
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit evam + ca

Examples

evañ'ca te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānā tath'eva paggaṇheyyuṃ, te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya

VIN PAT SA 11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ

evañ'ca kho eso, bhikkhu, pañho pucchitabbo

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
evañcetaṃ

sandhi. even if this; even if this is the case; lit. thus if this [evaṃ + ce + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + pron
Meaning even if this; even if this is the case; lit. thus if this
Construction evaṃ + ce + etaṃ
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit evam + ced + etam

Examples

purimā, bhikkhave, koṭi na paññāyati avijjāya, ito pubbe avijjā n'āhosi, atha pacchā samabhavī'ti. evañ'c'etaṃ, bhikkhave, vuccati, atha ca pana paññāyati, idappaccayā avijjā'ti

AN 10.61 avijjāsuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhu, bhikkhuno sutaṃ hoti, sabbe dhammā n'ālaṃ abhinivesāyā'ti. evañ'c'etaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhuno sutaṃ hoti, sabbe dhammā n'ālaṃ abhinivesāyā'ti.

SN 35.80 dutiyāvijjāpahānasuttaṃ
evañcettha

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind + adv
Meaning and in this case; lit. thus and here
Construction evaṃ + ca + ettha
Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit evam + ca + atra

Example

evañ'c'ettha, sunakkhatta, tathāgatassa hoti, dhammaṃ nesaṃ desessan'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
evañhi

Sanskrit evam + hi

evañ'hi te, moggallāna, sikkhitabbaṃ

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā, amhākañ'c'ev'āyaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
evadassī

adj. seeing in this way; having such insight ✗

Sanskrit evam + tam

Example

iti sakaraṇ'okāsānaṃ pubbakiccānaṃ katattā, nikkaraṇ'okāsānaṃ pubbakiccānaṃ pakatiyā pariniṭṭhitattā, evan'taṃ navavidhaṃ pubbakiccaṃ pariniṭṭhitaṃ hoti.

PAT PK dhammayuttikapubbakicca

Grammar sandhi, ind + card + masc
Meaning thus with three circles; with such three phases
Construction evaṃ + tiparivaṭṭaṃ

yāvakīvañ'ca me, bhikkhave, imesu catūsu ariyasaccesu evan'tiparivaṭṭaṃ dvādas'ākāraṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇadassanaṃ na suvisuddhaṃ ahosi

SN 56.11 dhammacakkappavattanasuttaṃ
evamakāsi

aor. (+acc) did this; acted like this [evaṃ + akāsi] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb (+acc)
Meaning did this; acted like this
Construction evaṃ + akāsi
Notes Kacc 491, 523
Sanskrit evam + akārṣīt

Example

accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā, yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, y'āhaṃ evam'akāsiṃ. tassā me, bhante, ayyo ānando accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu, āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā'ti.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ
evamakkhāyī

adj. asserting thus; declaring thus; preaching thus [evaṃ + akkhāyī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning asserting thus; declaring thus; preaching thus
Construction evaṃ + akkhāyī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + akkhāyī)
Sanskrit evam + ākhyāyin

Examples

evaṃvādiṃ kho maṃ, bhikkhave, evam'akkhāyiṃ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpetī'ti.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

yathā ca pana kāmehi visaṃyuttaṃ viharantaṃ taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ akathaṃkathiṃ chinnakukkuccaṃ bhav'ābhave vītataṇhaṃ saññā n'ānusenti, evaṃvādī kho ahaṃ, āvuso, evam'akkhāyī'ti

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
evamaññepi

sandhi. thus the rest too [evaṃ + aññe + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pn + ind
Meaning thus the rest too
Construction evaṃ + aññe + api
Sanskrit evam + anye + api

Examples

saṅgho pabbatam'iva attānam'ācarati, pabbatāyati. taḷākaṃ samuddam'iva attānam'ācarati, samuddāyati, saddo cicciṭam'iva attānam'ācarati, cicciṭāyati, vasiṭṭhassa apaccaṃ vāsiṭṭho. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 432

att'icch'atthe'ti kim'atthaṃ? aññassa pattam'icchati. evam'aññe'pi yojetabbā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 437
evamattho

sandhi. this is the meaning [evaṃ + attho] ~

Grammar sandhi, adv + masc
Meaning this is the meaning
Construction evaṃ + attho
evamanāvaraṇa

adj. thus posing no obstacle [evaṃ + anāvaraṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning thus posing no obstacle
Construction evaṃ + anāvaraṇa
evamanusāsati

pr. instructs in such a manner; teaches like this ✗
evamayaṃ

sandhi. thus this [evaṃ + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning thus this
Construction evaṃ + ayaṃ
Sanskrit evam + ayam

Example

evam'ayaṃ puggalo āyatiṃ aparihānadhammo bhavissatī'ti.

AN 6.62 purisindriyañāṇasuttaṃ
evamassa 1

sandhi. he would (think) thus; this would occur to him [evaṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + opt
Meaning he would (think) thus; this would occur to him
Construction evaṃ + assa
Sanskrit evam + syāt

Examples

tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

tassa purisassa uttiṇṇassa pāraṅ'gatassa evam'assa, bahukāro kho me ayaṃ kullo, im'āhaṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttiṇṇo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
evamassa 2

sandhi. such about him; this regarding him; lit. thus of him [evaṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning such about him; this regarding him; lit. thus of him
Construction evaṃ + assa
Sanskrit evam + asya

Examples

so evam'assa veditabbo, āneñjasaṃyojanena hi kho visaṃyutto lok'āmis'ādhimutto purisapuggalo'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, āraññako mago baddho pāsarāsiṃ adhisayeyya. so evam'assa veditabbo, anayam'āpanno byasanam'āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo luddassa.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
evamassa 3

sandhi. thus to him; thus to it [evaṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus to him; thus to it
Construction evaṃ + assa
Sanskrit evam + asmai

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo

VIN PAT SA 10 saṅghabhedasikkhāpadaṃ

tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evam'assa vacanīyo

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
evamassa 4

sandhi. thus his [evaṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus his
Construction evaṃ + assa
Sanskrit evam + asya

Example

te pañhaṃ abhisaṅkharonti, imaṃ mayaṃ pañhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma. evaṃ ce no puṭṭho evaṃ byākarissati, evam'assa mayaṃ vādaṃ āropessāma.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
evamassāda

adj. tasting like this; having such a flavour [evaṃ + assāda] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning tasting like this; having such a flavour
Construction evaṃ + assāda
evamassu

sandhi. they should be like this [evaṃ + assu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + opt
Meaning they should be like this
Construction evaṃ + assu
Sanskrit evam + syuḥ

Examples

te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi evam'assu vacanīyā, m'āyasmanto evaṃ avacuttha, na c'eso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na c'eso bhikkhu vinayavādī, m'āyasmantānam'pi saṅghabhedo ruccittha

VIN PAT SA 11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ

kā upanisā savanāyā'ti iti ce, bhikkhave, pucchitāro assu, te evam'assu vacanīyā, yāva'd'eva dvayatānaṃ dhammānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇāyā'ti. kiñ'ca dvayataṃ vadetha?

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
evamassu vacanīyā

idiom. should be spoken to thus; should be replied to in this way [evaṃ + assu + vacanīyā] ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + opt + ptp
Meaning should be spoken to thus; should be replied to in this way
Construction evaṃ + assu + vacanīyā
Sanskrit evam + syuḥ + vacanīya

Examples

kā upanisā savanāyā'ti iti ce, bhikkhave, pucchitāro assu, te evam'assu vacanīyā, yāva'd'eva dvayatānaṃ dhammānaṃ yathābhūtaṃ ñāṇāyā'ti. kiñ'ca dvayataṃ vadetha?

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ

evaṃvādino, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evam'assu vacanīyā, yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjh'aṅgānaṃ akālo bhāvanāya, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjh'aṅgānaṃ kālo bhāvanāya?

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
evamāgata

adj. thus concluded; lit. thus reached [evaṃ + āgata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning thus concluded; lit. thus reached
Construction evaṃ + āgata
Sanskrit evam + āgata

Example

attā me uppajjati ca veti cā'ti icc'assa evam'āgataṃ hoti. tasmā taṃ na upapajjati, cakkhu attā'ti yo vadeyya. iti cakkhu anattā.

MN 148 chachakkasuttaṃ
evamādi

adj. starting in such a manner [evaṃ + ādi] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning starting in such a manner
Construction evaṃ + ādi
evamādika

adj. thus such [evaṃ + ādika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning thus such
Construction evaṃ + ādika
evamāyupariyanta

adj. with such a life span [evaṃ + āyupariyanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with such a life span
Construction evaṃ + āyupariyanta
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + āyupariyanta)
Commentary (VINa) evam'āyupariyanto'ti evaṃ vassasataparam'āyupariyanto vā caturāsītikappasahassaparam'āyupariyanto vā. (MNa) evam'āyupariyanto'ti evaṃ sattapaññāsavassa-koṭisaṭṭhivassasatasahass'āyupariyanto.
Sanskrit evam + āyus + paryanta

Example

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
evamāroceti

pr. reports thus; informs this [evaṃ + āroceti] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning reports thus; informs this
Construction evaṃ + āroceti
evamārocetvā

abs. having informed this ✗
evamārocesi

aor. reported thus; informed this [evaṃ + ārocesi] ✓

Grammar aor of evamāroceti, comp vb
Meaning reported thus; informed this
Construction evaṃ + ārocesi
Commentary (DNa) evam'ārocesī'ti sakkaccaṃ dānaṃ dethā'tiādinā nayena ārocesi. (SNa) evam'ārocesī'ti dhammikaṃ samaṇā'tiādīni vadamānā sāsanassa niyyānikaṃ guṇaṃ kathesi. tañ'ca paribbājikāya kathaṃ sutvā pañcamattāni kulasatāni sāsane otariṃsū'ti.
Sanskrit evam + āruc

Example

kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ
evamāvuso

sandhi. yes friend; yes brothers [evaṃ + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc
Meaning yes friend; yes brothers
Construction evaṃ + āvuso
Sanskrit evam + āyusmanta

Examples

evam'āvuso'ti kho therā bhikkhū tassa bhikkhuno paccassosuṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

āyām'āvuso cunda, yen'āyasmā channo ten'upasaṅkamissāma gilānapucchakā'ti. evam'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahācundo āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosi.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
evamāha

sandhi. (+acc) one said thus [evaṃ + āha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + perf (+acc)
Meaning one said thus
Construction evaṃ + āha
Sanskrit evam + āha

Examples

vejjo, ayye, evam'āha, mā kira, ayye, pure kiñci adāsi

VIN 4.8.203 seṭṭhibhariyā vatthu

atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo evam'āha, aham'pi kho, brāhmaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
evamāhaṃsu

sandhi. (+acc) they said this; they spoke thus [evaṃ + āhaṃsu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + perf (+acc)
Meaning they said this; they spoke thus
Construction evaṃ + āhaṃsu
Sanskrit evam + āhuḥ

Examples

tam'enaṃ bhikkhū evam'āhaṃsu, m'āyasmā ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamī'ti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno evam'āha, ime hi nāma therā bhikkhū kulāni upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhan'ti?

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ

apissu maṃ, aggivessana, devatā disvā evam'āhaṃsu, kālaṅ'kato samaṇo gotamo'ti. ekaccā devatā evam'āhaṃsu, na kālaṅ'kato samaṇo gotamo, api ca kālaṅ'karotī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
evamāhāra

adj. eating such food; of such diet [evaṃ + āhāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning eating such food; of such diet
Construction evaṃ + āhāra
Commentary (VINa) evam'āhāro'ti sālimaṃs'odan'āhāro vā pavattaphalabhojano vā. (MNa) evam'āhāro'ti dibbasudh'āhāro.
Sanskrit evam + āhāra

Example

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
evamidaṃ

sandhi. thus this [evaṃ + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus this
Construction evaṃ + idaṃ
Sanskrit evam + idam

Examples

sace hi, bho gotama, imaṃ dhammaṃ bhavaṃ'y'eva gotamo ārādhako abhavissa, no ca kho bhikkhū ārādhakā abhavissaṃsu, evam'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ aparipūraṃ abhavissa ten'aṅgena.

MN 73 mahāvacchasuttaṃ

catunnaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam'idaṃ dīgham'addhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañ'c'eva tumhākañ'ca

DN 16.22 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
evamidhekacca

pron. thus here one; so here a certain; thus in this case some; so some people here [evaṃ + idha + ekacca] ✓

Grammar pron, comp
Meaning thus here one; so here a certain; thus in this case some; so some people here
Construction evaṃ + idha + ekacca
Sanskrit evam + iha + ekatya

Example

evaṃ dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam'idh'ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjanti.

MN 41 sāleyyakasuttaṃ
evamīdisa

adj. this such [evaṃ + īdisa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning this such
Construction evaṃ + īdisa
evamīdisesu

sandhi. thus in such [evaṃ + īdisesu] ~

Grammar sandhi, adv + adj
Meaning thus in such
Construction evaṃ + īdisesu
Sanskrit evam + īdṛśeṣu
evamupari

ind. and more than that ✗
evametasmā

sandhi. thus from this [evaṃ + etasmā] ~

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus from this
Construction evaṃ + etasmā
evametassa

sandhi. thus of this [evaṃ + etassa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus of this
Construction evaṃ + etassa
Sanskrit evam + etasya

Example

evam'etassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
evametaṃ

sandhi. so it is; just like that; exactly like that; lit. thus this [evaṃ + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning so it is; just like that; exactly like that; lit. thus this
Construction evaṃ + etaṃ
Commentary (SNa) evam'etaṃ, mahārājā'ti idha bhagavā imaṃ suttaṃ sabbaññubhāsitaṃ karonto āha.
Sanskrit evam + etam

Examples

evam'etaṃ bhaginiyo evam'etaṃ bhaginiyo!

SN 47.10 bhikkhunupassayasuttaṃ

ākiñcaññasambhavaṃ ñatvā,
nandī saṃyojanaṃ iti,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya,
tato tattha vipassati,
etaṃ ñāṇaṃ tathaṃ tassa,
brāhmaṇassa vusīmato'ti.

SNP 69 posāla māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 14
evametāsaṃ

sandhi. thus of these [evaṃ + etāsaṃ] ~

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning thus of these
Construction evaṃ + etāsaṃ
evametissā

sandhi. thus of this [evaṃ + etissā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus of this
Construction evaṃ + etissā
Sanskrit evam + etasyāḥ

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, y'āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā taṃ nissāya taṃ āgamma y'āyaṃ upekkhā nānattā nānattasitā taṃ pajahatha, taṃ samatikkamatha. evam'etissā pahānaṃ hoti, evam'etissā samatikkamo hoti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
evametesaṃ

sandhi. thus of these [evaṃ + etesaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning thus of these
Construction evaṃ + etesaṃ
Sanskrit evam + etānām

Examples

tatra, bhikkhave, yāni cha nekkhammasitāni somanassāni tāni nissāya tāni āgamma yāni cha gehasitāni somanassāni tāni pajahatha, tāni samatikkamatha. evam'etesaṃ pahānaṃ hoti, evam'etesaṃ samatikkamo hoti.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

evam'etesaṃ, bhikkhave, suttantānaṃ tathāgatabhāsitānaṃ gambhīrānaṃ gambhīr'atthānaṃ lok'uttarānaṃ suññatappaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ antaradhānaṃ bhavissati.

SN 20.7 āṇisuttaṃ
evametesu

sandhi. thus in these ✗
evamettha

sandhi. like this here; thus in this case [evaṃ + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + adv
Meaning like this here; thus in this case
Construction evaṃ + ettha
Commentary (SNa) evametthā'ti evaṃ mayhaṃ ettha bhavissati.
Sanskrit evam + atra

Example

bhaddakā vat'ime sunāparantakā manussā, subhaddakā vat'ime sunāparantakā manussā, yaṃ me na'y'ime pāṇinā pahāraṃ dentī'ti. evam'ettha, bhagavā, bhavissati, evam'ettha, sugata, bhavissatī'ti.

SN 35.88 puṇṇasuttaṃ
evameva

sandhi. similarly; in the same way; so too; just so [evaṃ + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning similarly; in the same way; so too; just so
Construction evaṃ + eva
Sanskrit evam + eva

Examples

atītam'p'āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam'eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā'pi eta'r'ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
evameva kho

idiom. similarly; in the same way; so too [evaṃ + eva + kho] ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + ind + ind
Meaning similarly; in the same way; so too
Construction evaṃ + eva + kho
Sanskrit evam + evam

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya satta bojjh'aṅge bhāveti, satta bojjh'aṅge bahulīkaroti.

SN 46.11 pāṇasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
evamevassu

sandhi. similarly indeed; truly in the same way; in exactly the same way [evaṃ + eva + ssu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + ind
Meaning similarly indeed; truly in the same way; in exactly the same way
Construction evaṃ + eva + ssu
Sanskrit evam + evam + sma

Example

seyyathā'pi nāma āsītikapabbāni vā kāḷapabbāni vā, evam'ev'assu me aṅgapaccaṅgāni bhavanti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya. seyyathā'pi nāma oṭṭhapadaṃ, evam'ev'assu me ānisadaṃ hoti tāy'ev'app'āhāratāya.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
evamevaṃ

sandhi. similarly; in exactly the same way; so too [evaṃ + evaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + adv
Meaning similarly; in exactly the same way; so too
Construction evaṃ + evaṃ
Sanskrit evam + evam

Examples

maṃ ce'pi tumhe, bhikkhave, etam'atthaṃ paṭipuccheyyātha, aham'pi taṃ evam'evaṃ byākareyyaṃ yathā taṃ mahākaccānena byākataṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti. evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.

DN 14.13 mahāpadānasuttaṃ
evamevāyaṃ

sandhi. similarly this; in the same way this; so too he; just so he [evaṃ + eva + ayaṃ] ~

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + pron
Meaning similarly this; in the same way this; so too he; just so he
Construction evaṃ + eva + ayaṃ
Sanskrit evam + eva + ayam
evamesā

sandhi. thus this [evaṃ + esā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus this
Construction evaṃ + esā
Sanskrit evam + eṣā

Example

evamesā kasī kaṭṭhā,
sā hoti amatapphalā,
etaṃ kasiṃ kasitvāna,
sabbadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

SNP 4 kasibhāradvājasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 4
evampi

sandhi. likewise; just like this; similarly; so too [evaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind
Meaning likewise; just like this; similarly; so too
Construction evaṃ + api
Sanskrit evam + api

Examples

yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe,
chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati,
evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate,
nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.

DHP 338 taṇhāvaggo

supinena yathā'pi saṅgataṃ,
paṭibuddho puriso na passati,
evam'pi piyāyitaṃ janaṃ,
petaṃ kālakataṃ na passati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
evambandhanīya

adj. so captivating; so bewitching; so enchanting [evaṃ + bandhanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so captivating; so bewitching; so enchanting
Construction evaṃ + bandhanīya
Phonetic Change ṃ > m
Variant evaṃbandhanīya
evarūpa

adj. such; similar kind of; of such quality [evaṃ + rūpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning such; similar kind of; of such quality
Construction evaṃ + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + rūpa)
Synonym tathārūpa, tādi, tādisa, tādī
Sanskrit evaṃrūpa

Examples

idha mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me, yo'haṃ evarūpehi sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṃ viharāmī'ti

MN 31 cūḷagosiṅgasuttaṃ

evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
evarūpamakāsi

aor. did such a thing; performed such an action [evarūpaṃ + akāsi] ~

Grammar aor, comp vb
Meaning did such a thing; performed such an action
Construction evarūpaṃ + akāsi
evarūpāpi

sandhi. even such; even such kind of [evarūpā + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning even such; even such kind of
Construction evarūpā + api
Sanskrit evaṃrūpāḥ + api

Examples

evarūpā'pi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

evarūpā'pi kho me, aggivessana, uppannā sukhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhati.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
evarūpī

adj. of such kind; of such quality [eva + rūpa + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, fem nom sg of evarūpa
Meaning of such kind; of such quality
Construction eva + rūpa + ī
evarūpa + ī
Compound kammadhāraya (eva + rūpī)
Sanskrit evaṃrūpā

Examples

kathañ'ca, gahapati, kathaṃ viggayha janena kattā hoti? idha, gahapati, ekacco evarūpiṃ kathaṃ kattā hoti, na tvaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāsi, ahaṃ imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ ājānāmi

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

ye kho te bhikkhū sekkhā apattamānasā anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ
patthayamānā viharanti tesu me ayaṃ evarūpī anusāsanī hoti.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
evarūpepi 1

sandhi. in just such quality (person) [evarūpe + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning in just such quality (person)
Construction evarūpe + api
Sanskrit evaṃrūpe + api

Example

evarūpe'pi, āvuso, puggale kāruññaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ anuddayā'y'eva upaṭṭhāpetabbā anukampā'y'eva upaṭṭhāpetabbā

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
evarūpepi 2

sandhi. even when such [evarūpe + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning even when such
Construction evarūpe + api
Sanskrit evaṃrūpe + api

Example

acchariyaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa, abbhutaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa! evarūpe'pi nāma sāvakayuge parinibbute n'atthi tathāgatassa soko vā paridevo vā!

SN 47.14 ukkacelasuttaṃ
evarūpopi

sandhi. just like that; exactly like this [evarūpo + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning just like that; exactly like this
Construction evarūpo + api
Sanskrit evaṃrūpa + api

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchato paṭikkamati, piṭṭhito rathaṃ pavatteti. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko, pehī'ti vutto, viddho samāno codito sārathinā pacchā laṅghati, kubbaraṃ hanati, tidaṇḍaṃ bhañjati. evarūpo'pi, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco assakhaḷuṅko hoti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo assadoso.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ
evassa

sandhi. even his; just his [eva + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning even his; just his
Construction eva + assa
Sanskrit eva + asya

Examples

ujugatam'ev'assa tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ hoti sīlaṃ ārabbha.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ

amissīkatam'ev'assa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ vayañ'c'ass'ānupassati.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
evassu

sandhi. thus they would be [eva + assu] ~

Grammar sandhi, ind + opt
Meaning thus they would be
Construction eva + assu
Commentary (ANa) ev'assū'ti evaṃ bhaveyyuṃ.
evaṃ eva

idiom. just so, just like that ✗
evaṃ 1

ind. thus; this; like this; similarly; in the same manner; just as; such [eva + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning thus; this; like this; similarly; in the same manner; just as; such
Construction eva + aṃ
Synonym iti, itthaṃ, tathā
Sanskrit evam

Examples

ajjhattañ'ca bahiddhā ca,
vedanaṃ n'ābhinandato,
evaṃ satassa carato,
viññāṇaṃ uparujjhatī'ti.

SNP 68 udaya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 13

accī yathā vātavegena khittā,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ,
evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
evaṃ 2

ind. yes!; that is right!; correct! [eva + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, excl
Meaning yes!; that is right!; correct!
Construction eva + aṃ
Sanskrit evam

Examples

nanu te, bhikkhave, yāva'd'eva kantārassa nittharaṇ'atthāya āhāraṃ āhāreyyun'ti? evaṃ, bhante

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

bhabbo nu kho so puriso parittaṃ aggiṃ ujjālitun'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
evaṃ no ettha hoti

idiom. we see it like this; we understand it in this way; lit. it is like this for us here ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + pron + adv + pr
Meaning we see it like this; we understand it in this way; lit. it is like this for us here
Sanskrit evam + naḥ + atra + bhavati

Example

bhavapaccayā nu kho, bhikkhave, jāti, no vā, kathaṃ vā ettha hotī'ti? bhavapaccayā, bhante, jāti, evaṃ no ettha hoti, bhavapaccayā jātī'ti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
evaṃ me ettha hoti

idiom. I see it like this; I understand it in this way; lit. it is like this for me here ~

Grammar idiom, adv + pron + adv + pr
Meaning I see it like this; I understand it in this way; lit. it is like this for me here
Sanskrit evam + me + atra + bhavati
evaṃ me sutaṃ

idiom. I heard it like this; lit. thus heard by me ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + pron + pp
Meaning I heard it like this; lit. thus heard by me

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubb'ārāme migāramātupāsāde

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati assapuraṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
evaṃ vutte

idiom. when this was said ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + pp, loc abs
Meaning when this was said

Examples

evaṃ vutte, so puggalo tuṇhī ahosi.

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etadavoca, phasso kho, āvuso, eko anto, phassasamudayo dutiyo anto, phassanirodho majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ
evaṃ santaṃ

idiom. this being the case; this being so ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + prp
Meaning this being the case; this being so
Synonym evaṃ sante

Examples

saññā nu kho, oḷāriko ca hi te, poṭṭhapāda, attā abhavissa rūpī cātumahābhūtiko kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkho. evaṃ santaṃ kho te, poṭṭhapāda, aññā'va saññā bhavissati añño attā.

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

yo, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
evaṃ santāyaṃ

idiom. in this case; this being the case [evaṃ + santa + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + prp + pron
Meaning in this case; this being the case
Construction evaṃ + santa + ayaṃ
Sanskrit evam + sat + ayam

Example

sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ek'aṃsabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ek'aṃsena byākaroti, vibhajjabyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na vibhajja byākaroti, paṭipucchābyākaraṇīyaṃ pañhaṃ na paṭipucchā byākaroti, ṭhapanīyaṃ pañhaṃ na ṭhapeti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ
evaṃ sante

idiom. this being the case; this being so; lit. when is thus ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + prp, loc abs
Meaning this being the case; this being so; lit. when is thus
Synonym evaṃ santaṃ

Examples

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, poṭṭhapāda, nanu evaṃ sante sappāṭihīrakataṃ bhāsitaṃ sampajjatī'ti? addhā kho, bhante, evaṃ sante sappāṭihīrakataṃ bhāsitaṃ sampajjatī'ti

DN 9.7 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

evaṃ sante kho, uttara, andho bhāvitindriyo bhavissati, badhiro bhāvit'indriyo bhavissati.

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ
evaṃ hoti

idiom. (+dat) the thought occurs (to); lit. it is like this ✓

Grammar idiom, adv + pr (+dat)
Meaning the thought occurs (to); lit. it is like this

Examples

ye pana te bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsu tatra, sunakkhatta, tathāgatassa evaṃ hoti, dhammaṃ nesaṃ desessan'ti.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

tattha hatth'ārohassa evaṃ hoti, ayaṃ kho rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgām'āvacaro saṅgāmagato… rakkhat'eva soṇḍaṃ.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
evaṃadhippāya

adj. having such intention; of such disposition [evaṃ + adhippāya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such intention; of such disposition
Construction evaṃ + adhippāya
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + adhippāya)
Commentary (MNa) evaṃadhippāyā'ti evaṃladdhikā.
Sanskrit evam + abhiprāya

Example

yebhuyyena, bhikkhave, sattā evaṃkāmā evaṃchandā evaṃadhippāyā, aho vata aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā dhammā parihāyeyyuṃ, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā dhammā abhivaḍḍheyyun'ti.

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
evaṃanatīta

adj. not past this; subject to this in future; yet to experience this; lit. thus not past [evaṃ + anatīta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning not past this; subject to this in future; yet to experience this; lit. thus not past
Construction evaṃ + anatīta
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + anatīta)
Variant etaṃ anatīta
Commentary (DNa) evaṃanatīto evaṃ uddhumāt'ādibhāvaṃ anatikkanto'ti.
Sanskrit evam + atīta

Example

so imam'eva kāyaṃ upasaṃharati, ayam'pi kho kāyo evaṃdhammo evaṃbhāvī evaṃanatīto'ti

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

Meaning so obstructive; as impeding as (for)
Construction evaṃ + antarāyakara
evaṃappakasirena

ind. just as easily; with as little difficulty as this [evaṃ + appakasirena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning just as easily; with as little difficulty as this
Construction evaṃ + appakasirena
evaṃabhisamparāya

masc. such a future state; such a future destination ✗
evaṃkaṭuka

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so severe; as painful as
Construction evaṃ + kaṭuka
Variant evaṅkaṭuka

adj. so desirable; so adorable; so enticing [evaṃ + kamanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so desirable; so adorable; so enticing
Construction evaṃ + kamanīya
Synonym evaṃrajanīya
Variant evaṅkamanīya

adj. having such desire; with such wish [evaṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such desire; with such wish
Construction evaṃ + kāma
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + kāma)
Variant evaṅkāma
Commentary (MNa) evaṃkāmā'ti evaṃicchā.
Sanskrit evam + kāma

Example

yebhuyyena, bhikkhave, sattā evaṃkāmā evaṃchandā evaṃadhippāyā, aho vata aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā dhammā parihāyeyyuṃ, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā dhammā abhivaḍḍheyyun'ti.

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
evaṃkārī

adj. acting like this; doing such things; lit. thus doer [evaṃ + kārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning acting like this; doing such things; lit. thus doer
Construction evaṃ + kārī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + kārī)
Variant evaṅkārī
Sanskrit evam + kārin

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso evaṃkārī tasmiṃ kulle kiccakārī assā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
evaṃgata

adj. in such a state; of such kind [evaṃ + gata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in such a state; of such kind
Construction evaṃ + gata
Variant evaṅgata
Commentary (DNa) evaṃgatānī'ti evaṃ pavattāni.
Sanskrit evam + gata
evaṃgatika

adj. having such a course; with a path like this [evaṃ + gatika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such a course; with a path like this
Construction evaṃ + gatika
Variant evaṅgatika
Sanskrit evam + gatika
evaṃgahita

adj. held in such a way; thus grasped onto [evaṃ + gahita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning held in such a way; thus grasped onto
Construction evaṃ + gahita
Variant evaṅgahita
Commentary (DNa) evaṃgahitā'ti diṭṭhisaṅkhātā tāva diṭṭhiṭṭhānā, sassato attā ca loko cā'ti evaṃgahitā ādinnā, pavattitā'ti attho.
Sanskrit evam + gṛbhita, gṛhīta
evaṃgotta

adj. of such family clan; of this lineage [evaṃ + gotta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such family clan; of this lineage
Construction evaṃ + gotta
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + gotta)
Variant evaṅgotta
Commentary (VINa) evaṃgotto'ti bhaggavo vā gotamo vā (MNa) evaṃgotto'ti tāhi devatāhi saddhiṃ ekagotto.
Sanskrit evaṃgotra

Examples

jānāsi taṃ janapadakalyāṇiṃ evaṃnāmā evaṃgottā'ti vā, dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vā'ti, amukasmiṃ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto

DN 1.6 brahmajālasuttaṃ
evaṃcitta

adj. with the thought; with the idea; lit. with such a mind [evaṃ + citta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the thought; with the idea; lit. with such a mind
Construction evaṃ + citta
evaṃciraṭṭhitika

adj. so long lasting; enduring so long; lit. thus long standing [evaṃ + ciraṭṭhitika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so long lasting; enduring so long; lit. thus long standing
Construction evaṃ + ciraṭṭhitika
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + ciraṭṭhitika)
Sanskrit evam + cirasthitika

Example

tā ca devatā jānāmi, imā devatā evaṃdīgh'āyukā evaṃciraṭṭhitikā'ti, no ca kho tā devatā jānāmi yadi vā me imāhi devatāhi saddhiṃ sannivutthapubbaṃ yadi vā na sannivutthapubban'ti.

AN 8.64 gayāsīsasuttaṃ
evaṃchanda

adj. having such interest; of such inclination [evaṃ + chanda] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such interest; of such inclination

Commentary (MNa) evaṃchandā'ti evaṃajjhāsayā.
Sanskrit evam + chanda

Example

yebhuyyena, bhikkhave, sattā evaṃkāmā evaṃchandā evaṃadhippāyā, aho vata aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā dhammā parihāyeyyuṃ, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā dhammā abhivaḍḍheyyun'ti.

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
evaṃjacca

adj. of such and such a class; of this kind of family ✗

ind. just as quickly; as immediately as this [evaṃ + tuvaṭaṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning just as quickly; as immediately as this
Construction evaṃ + tuvaṭaṃ
evaṃdāruṇa

adj. so brutal; so savage; as vicious as [evaṃ + dāruṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so brutal; so savage; as vicious as
Construction evaṃ + dāruṇa
evaṃdiṭṭhika

adj. having such view; holding such an opinion [evaṃ + diṭṭhi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such view; holding such an opinion
Construction evaṃ + diṭṭhi + ka
evaṃdiṭṭhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit evam + dṛṣṭika

Example

api ca kho evaṃdiṭṭhikā ahesuṃ, sassato loko iti'pi, asassato loko iti'pi, antavā loko iti'pi, anantavā loko iti'pi, taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīraṃ iti'pi, aññaṃ jīvaṃ aññaṃ sarīraṃ iti'pi, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā iti'pi

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
evaṃdiṭṭhī

adj. of such view; who holds the theory that; of the opinion that; who thinks that [evaṃ + diṭṭhī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such view; who holds the theory that; of the opinion that; who thinks that
Construction evaṃ + diṭṭhī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + diṭṭhī)
Variant evaṃdiṭṭhika
Sanskrit evam + dṛṣṭin

Examples

evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
evaṃdīghāyuka

adj. having such a long lifespan; so long-lived [evaṃ + dīgha + āyuka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such a long lifespan; so long-lived
Construction evaṃ + dīgha + āyuka
evaṃdukkha

adj. so painful; as uncomfortable as [evaṃ + dukkha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so painful; as uncomfortable as
Construction evaṃ + dukkha
evaṃdhamma

adj. of such nature; of such character; lit. thus nature [evaṃ + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such nature; of such character; lit. thus nature
Construction evaṃ + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + dhamma)
Commentary (MNa) evaṃdhammo'ti ettha pana samādhipakkhikā dhammā dhammā'ti adhippetā.
Sanskrit evam + dharma

Examples

sa kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃsīlo evaṃdhammo evaṃpañño sālīnaṃ ce'pi piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati vicitakāḷakaṃ anekasūpaṃ anekabyañjanaṃ, n'ev'assa taṃ hoti antarāyāya.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

so imam'eva kāyaṃ upasaṃharati, ayam'pi kho kāyo evaṃdhammo evaṃbhāvī evaṃanatīto'ti

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
evaṃdhammatā

fem. ineluctable regularity ✗
evaṃnava

adj. such a junior [evaṃ + nava] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning such a junior
Construction evaṃ + nava
evaṃnāma

adj. of such name; so called [evaṃ + nāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such name; so called
Construction evaṃ + nāma
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + nāma)
Synonym evaṃnāmaka, yathānāma
Commentary (VINa) evaṃnāmo'ti vessantaro vā jotipālo vā. (MNa) evaṃnāmo'ti tatr'āpi tusitabhavane setaketu nāma devaputto ahosiṃ.
Sanskrit evaṃnāman

Examples

jānāsi taṃ janapadakalyāṇiṃ evaṃnāmā evaṃgottā'ti vā, dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vā'ti, amukasmiṃ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto

evaṃnāmaka

Sanskrit evaṃ + nāmaka
evaṃnāmika

adj. so called; of such name ✗
evaṃpañña

adj. of such wisdom [evaṃ + pañña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such wisdom
Construction evaṃ + pañña
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + pañña)
Sanskrit evam + prajña
