sa kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃsīlo evaṃdhammo evaṃpañño sālīnaṃ ce'pi piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati vicitakāḷakaṃ anekasūpaṃ anekabyañjanaṃ, n'ev'assa taṃ hoti antarāyāya.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
evaṃpaṭiññā

fem. such a claim; such an acknowledgement [evaṃ + paṭiññā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning such a claim; such an acknowledgement
Construction evaṃ + paṭiññā
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + paṭiññā)
Sanskrit evam + pratijñā

Example

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ ye dhammā samaṇakaraṇā ca brāhmaṇakaraṇā ca te dhamme samādāya vattissāma, evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
evaṃpaṭipanna

adj. practising like this; going along like this; who practice in such a way; lit. gone along like this [evaṃ + paṭipanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning practising like this; going along like this; who practice in such a way; lit. gone along like this
Construction evaṃ + paṭipanna
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + paṭipanna)
Sanskrit evam + pratipanna

Examples

suppaṭipann'āttha, mārisā, ujuppaṭipann'āttha, mārisā, ek'antasukhassa lokassa sacchikiriyāya. mayam'pi hi, mārisā, evaṃpaṭipannā ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ upapannā'ti? iti puṭṭhā no'ti vadanti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ catunnaṃ paṭipadānaṃ yadidaṃ sukhā paṭipadā khipp'ābhiññā. evaṃpaṭipannā'pi kho, bhikkhave, santi sattā. evaṃpaṭipannānam'pi kho, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
evaṃparāmaṭṭha

adj. clung to in such a way; thus adhered to ✗
evaṃpasanna

adj. having such faith; having such confidence ✗
evaṃbandhanīya

adj. so captivating; so bewitching; so enchanting; lit. so binding [evaṃ + bandhanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so captivating; so bewitching; so enchanting; lit. so binding
Construction evaṃ + bandhanīya
Variant evambandhanīya
evaṃbyākho

sandhi. yes indeed; exactly so; most certainly [evaṃ + byā + kho] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + ind + ind
Meaning yes indeed; exactly so; most certainly
Construction evaṃ + byā + kho
Sanskrit evam + iva + khalu

Example

evaṃbyākho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
evaṃbhāga

adj. like this; lit. with such parts [evaṃ + bhāga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like this; lit. with such parts
Construction evaṃ + bhāga
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + bhāga)
Antonym kathaṃbhāga
Sanskrit evam + bhāga

Example

evaṃ kho, aggivessana, bhagavā sāvake vineti, evaṃbhāgā ca pana bhagavato sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati, rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ, vedanā aniccā, saññā aniccā, saṅkhārā aniccā, viññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
evaṃbhāvī

adj. destined for this; thus fated; going to be such; lit. thus fate [evaṃ + bhāvī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning destined for this; thus fated; going to be such; lit. thus fate
Construction evaṃ + bhāvī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + bhāvī)
Commentary (DNa) evaṃbhāvī evaṃ uddhumāt'ādibhedo bhavissati
Sanskrit evam + bhāvin

Example

so imam'eva kāyaṃ upasaṃharati, ayam'pi kho kāyo evaṃdhammo evaṃbhāvī evaṃanatīto'ti

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
evaṃbhūta

adj. like this; in such a state [evaṃ + bhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like this; in such a state
Construction evaṃ + bhūta
Commentary (ANa) evaṃbhūto'ti evaṃ paṭhamajjhān'ādīsu aññatarasamaṅgī hutvā.
evaṃmadanīya

adj. so intoxicating; so exciting [evaṃ + madanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so intoxicating; so exciting
Construction evaṃ + madanīya
evaṃmahānubhāva

adj. of such mighty power; of such mighty splendour; of such great majesty; of such great magnificence; lit. great splendour [evaṃ + mahā + ānubhāva] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such mighty power; of such mighty splendour; of such great majesty; of such great magnificence; lit. great splendour
Construction evaṃ + mahā + ānubhāva
Variant evaṃ mahānubhāva
Sanskrit evam + mahānubhāva

Examples

ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo, ime'pi candimasūriye evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmah'ānubhāve pāṇinā parāmaseyyaṃ parimajjeyyaṃ yāva brahmalokā'pi kāyena vasaṃ vatteyyan'ti

MN 6 ākaṅkheyyasuttaṃ

eso nu te, mārisa, so bhagavā satthā'ti? na kho me, mārisa, so bhagavā satthā. sabrahmacārī me eso āyasmā mahāmoggallāno'ti. lābhā te, mārisa, suladdhaṃ te, mārisa yassa te sabrahmacārī evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmah'ānubhāvo! aho nūna te so bhagavā satthā'ti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
evaṃmahiddhika

adj. of such great supernatural power; so magically powerful [evaṃ + mahā + iddhi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from iddhi
Meaning of such great supernatural power; so magically powerful
Construction evaṃ + mahā + iddhi + ka
evaṃmahiddhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Variant evaṃ mahiddhika
Sanskrit evam + mahā + siddhika

Examples

ākāse'pi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathā'pi pakkhī sakuṇo, ime'pi candimasūriye evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmah'ānubhāve pāṇinā parāmaseyyaṃ parimajjeyyaṃ yāva brahmalokā'pi kāyena vasaṃ vatteyyan'ti

MN 6 ākaṅkheyyasuttaṃ

eso nu te, mārisa, so bhagavā satthā'ti? na kho me, mārisa, so bhagavā satthā. sabrahmacārī me eso āyasmā mahāmoggallāno'ti. lābhā te, mārisa, suladdhaṃ te, mārisa yassa te sabrahmacārī evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmah'ānubhāvo! aho nūna te so bhagavā satthā'ti.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
evaṃmahesakkha

adj. of such renown; of such great influence; so distinguished; so important [evaṃ + mahā + yasas + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such renown; of such great influence; so distinguished; so important
Construction evaṃ + mahā + yasas + ka
evaṃmahāyasas + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change āya > e
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + mahesakkha)
Sanskrit evam + maheśākhya (bsk)

Example

acchariyaṃ, nandamāte, abbhutaṃ, nandamāte! yatra hi nāma vessavaṇena mahārājena evaṃmahiddhikena evaṃmahesakkhena devaputtena sammukhā sallapissasīti.

AN 7.53 nandamātāsuttaṃ
evaṃmānī

adj. overestimating oneself in such a manner [evaṃ + mānī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning overestimating oneself in such a manner
Construction evaṃ + mānī
evaṃmucchanīya

adj. so entrancing; so enchanting; so bewitching [evaṃ + mucchanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so entrancing; so enchanting; so bewitching
Construction evaṃ + mucchanīya
evaṃrajanīya

adj. so desirable; so arousing; so enticing [evaṃ + rajanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning so desirable; so arousing; so enticing
Construction evaṃ + rajanīya
Synonym evaṅkamanīya, evaṃkamanīya
evaṃrūpa

adj. of such form; like this [evaṃ + rūpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such form; like this
Construction evaṃ + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + rūpa)
Commentary (MNa) evaṃrūpo'tiādīsu kāḷo'pi samāno indanīlamaṇivaṇṇo ahosin'ti evaṃ manuññarūpavasen'eva evaṃrūpo ahosiṃ.
Sanskrit evam + rūpa

Examples

kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

evaṃrūpo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti, iti vā hi, bhikkhave, anussaramāno rūpaṃ'y'eva anussarati

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ
evaṃladdhanāma

adj. having thus received the name; thus given the name ✗
evaṃlābhaggayasaggappatta

adj. reached such a peak of material gain and fame [evaṃ + lābhagga + yasagga + patta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning reached such a peak of material gain and fame
Construction evaṃ + lābhagga + yasagga + patta
evaṃvaṇṇa

adj. of such appearance [evaṃ + vaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such appearance
Construction evaṃ + vaṇṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + vaṇṇa)
Commentary (VINa) evaṃvaṇṇo'ti odāto vā sāmo vā. (MNa) evaṃvaṇṇo'ti suvaṇṇavaṇṇo.
Sanskrit evam + varṇa

Example

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
evaṃvādī

adj. of such view; who hold the view that; having a theory that [evaṃ + vādī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such view; who hold the view that; having a theory that
Construction evaṃ + vādī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + vādī)
Sanskrit evam + vādin

Examples

evam'eva kho, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, ek'antasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṃ maraṇā'ti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ

evaṃvādino, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evam'assu vacanīyā, yasmiṃ, āvuso, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjh'aṅgānaṃ akālo bhāvanāya, katamesaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bojjh'aṅgānaṃ kālo bhāvanāya?

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
evaṃviññāṇa

adj. having such consciousness; with this kind of awareness; lit. knowing like this [evaṃ + viññāṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such consciousness; with this kind of awareness; lit. knowing like this
Construction evaṃ + viññāṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + viññāṇa)
Commentary (MNa) taṃsampayuttānaṃ'y'eva saññ'ādīnaṃ vasena evaṃsañño evaṃsaṅkhāro evaṃviññāṇo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti.
Sanskrit evam + vijñāna

Examples

evaṃsañño siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃsaṅkhāro siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃviññāṇo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānan'ti. evaṃ kho, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

evaṃsaṅkhāro ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃviññāṇo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atītaṃ anvāgameti.

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
evaṃvidha

adj. such like ✗
evaṃvipāka

adj. having such consequences; with such a result ✗
evaṃvimutta

adj. liberated in such a way ✗
evaṃvimuttacitta

adj. with mind liberated in such a way; with such kind of emancipated heart [evaṃ + vimuttacitta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mind liberated in such a way; with such kind of emancipated heart
Construction evaṃ + vimuttacitta
Commentary (MNa) idāni evaṃ vimuttacittassa khīṇ'āsavoassa parehi anadhigamanīyaviññāṇataṃ dassento evaṃ vimuttacittaṃ kho'tiādim'āha.
evaṃvihārī

adj. who lives in this way; living like this [evaṃ + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who lives in this way; living like this
Construction evaṃ + vihārī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + vihārī)
Sanskrit evam + vihārin

Example

evaṃvihārī sato appamatto,
bhikkhu caraṃ hitvā mamāyitāni,
jātiṃ jaraṃ sokapariddavañ'ca,
idh'eva vidvā pajaheyya dukkhaṃ.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
evaṃvihitaka

adj. determined, effected in this way ✗
evaṃvedana

adj. having such feeling; having this kind of sensation [evaṃ + vedanā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such feeling; having this kind of sensation
Construction evaṃ + vedanā + a
evaṃvedanā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + vedana)
Commentary (MNa) kusalasukhasomanassavedanāvasen'eva evaṃvedano.
Sanskrit evam + vedanā

Examples

kathañ'ca, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti? idha, gahapati, ekaccassa evaṃ hoti, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃvedano siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

evaṃrūpo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃvedano ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃsañño ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
evaṃsa

sandhi. thus his; thus for him [evaṃ + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pron
Meaning thus his; thus for him
Construction evaṃ + assa
Sanskrit evam + asya

Examples

yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, anadhivāsayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, adhivāsayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti

MN 2.5 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, avinodayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, vinodayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti. ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā vinodanā pahātabbā.

MN 2.7 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
evaṃsaṅkhāra

adj. having such mental activity; having this kind of intention; having such thoughts [evaṃ + saṅkhāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such mental activity; having this kind of intention; having such thoughts
Construction evaṃ + saṅkhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + saṅkhāra)
Commentary (MNa) taṃsampayuttānaṃ'y'eva saññ'ādīnaṃ vasena evaṃsañño evaṃsaṅkhāro evaṃviññāṇo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti.
Sanskrit evam + saṃskāra

Examples

evaṃsañño siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃsaṅkhāro siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃviññāṇo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānan'ti. evaṃ kho, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

evaṃsaṅkhāro ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃviññāṇo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atītaṃ anvāgameti.

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
evaṃsañña

adj. having such recognition; having this kind of perception [evaṃ + saññā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having such recognition; having this kind of perception
Construction evaṃ + saññā + a
evaṃsaññā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + sañña)
Commentary (MNa) taṃsampayuttānaṃ'y'eva saññ'ādīnaṃ vasena evaṃsañño evaṃsaṅkhāro evaṃviññāṇo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti.
Sanskrit evam + saṃjña

Examples

evaṃsañño siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃsaṅkhāro siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānaṃ, evaṃviññāṇo siyaṃ anāgatam'addhānan'ti. evaṃ kho, gahapati, purakkharāno hoti.

SN 22.3 hāliddikānisuttaṃ

evaṃrūpo ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃvedano ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti, evaṃsañño ahosiṃ atītam'addhānan'ti tattha nandiṃ samanvāneti

MN 131 bhaddekarattasuttaṃ
evaṃsaññī

adj. of such perception; percipient in such a way [evaṃ + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such perception; percipient in such a way
Construction evaṃ + saññī
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + saññī)
Sanskrit evam + saṃjñin

Examples

puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu sabbaso viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ samatikkamma, n'atthi kiñcī'ti ākiñcaññ'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati. evaṃsaññī'pi kho, āvuso, tadāyatanaṃ no paṭisaṃvedetī'ti.

AN 9.37 ānandasuttaṃ

etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, imesaṃ dasannaṃ kasiṇ'āyatanānaṃ yadidaṃ viññāṇakasiṇaṃ eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ. evaṃsaññino'pi kho, bhikkhave, santi sattā.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ
evaṃsadda 1

masc. the word "thus" [evaṃ + sadda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the word "thus"
Construction evaṃ + sadda
Synonym itisadda
Sanskrit evam + śabda
evaṃsadda 2

adj. of such repute; with such a reputation [evaṃ + sadda] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such repute; with such a reputation
Construction evaṃ + sadda
Sanskrit evam + śabda
evaṃsaddha

adj. having such a reputation ✗
evaṃsamaññā

fem. such a designation; such a label [evaṃ + samaññā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning such a designation; such a label
Construction evaṃ + samaññā
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + samaññā)
Sanskrit evam + samājñā

Example

tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ ye dhammā samaṇakaraṇā ca brāhmaṇakaraṇā ca te dhamme samādāya vattissāma, evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
evaṃsamācāra

adj. behaving like this; lit. such behaviour [evaṃ + samācāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning behaving like this; lit. such behaviour
Construction evaṃ + samācāra
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + samācāra)
Sanskrit evam + samācāra

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco bhikkhu gāmagato vā araññagato vā labhati vattāraṃ, ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ

ayañ'ca kho āyasmā evaṃkārī evaṃsamācāro asucigāmakaṇṭako'ti. taṃ kaṇṭako'ti iti viditvā saṃvaro ca asaṃvaro ca veditabbo.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakopamasuttaṃ
evaṃsiloka

adj. of such infamy; of such notoriety [evaṃ + siloka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such infamy; of such notoriety
Construction evaṃ + siloka
evaṃsīghaṃ

ind. just as quickly; so swiftly; as rapidly as this [evaṃ + sīghaṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning just as quickly; so swiftly; as rapidly as this
Construction evaṃ + sīghaṃ
evaṃsīla

adj. of such virtue; of such moral excellence [evaṃ + sīla] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such virtue; of such moral excellence
Construction evaṃ + sīla
Compound kammadhāraya (evaṃ + sīla)
Sanskrit evam + śīla

Example

sa kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃsīlo evaṃdhammo evaṃpañño sālīnaṃ ce'pi piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjati vicitakāḷakaṃ anekasūpaṃ anekabyañjanaṃ, n'ev'assa taṃ hoti antarāyāya.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing such ease and discomfort; feeling such kind of pleasure and pain [evaṃ + sukhadukkha + paṭisaṃvedī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing such ease and discomfort; feeling such kind of pleasure and pain
Construction evaṃ + sukhadukkha + paṭisaṃvedī
evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī

adj. experiencing such pleasure and pain; feeling such ease and discomfort [evaṃ + sukhadukkha + paṭisaṃvedī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning experiencing such pleasure and pain; feeling such ease and discomfort
Construction evaṃ + sukhadukkha + paṭisaṃvedī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (evaṃsukhadukkhaṃ + ppaṭisaṃvedī)
Commentary (VINa) evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī'ti anekappakārena kāyikacetasikānaṃ sāmisanirāmis'ādippabhedānaṃ vā sukhadukkhānaṃ paṭisaṃvedī. (MNa) evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī'ti evaṃ dibbasukhapaṭisaṃvedī. dukkhaṃ pana saṅkhāradukkhamattam'eva.
Sanskrit evam + sukhaduḥkha + pratisaṃvedin

Example

amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evam'āhāro evaṃsukhadukkhapaṭisaṃvedī evam'āyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
evaṃsutivant

adj. (gram) having such a sound [evaṃ + sutivant] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) having such a sound
Construction evaṃ + sutivant
Sanskrit evam + śruti +
evaṃsmīti

sandhi. I am like that; I am the same [evaṃ + asmi + iti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adv + pr + ind
Meaning I am like that; I am the same
Construction evaṃ + asmi + iti
Commentary (ANa) tattha evaṃ'smī'ti idaṃ samato upanidhāya gahaṇaṃ, yath'āyaṃ khattiyo yath'āyaṃ brāhmaṇo, evam'aham'pī'ti attho.
Sanskrit evam + asmi + iti

Example

asmī'ti, bhikkhave, sati itth'asmī'ti hoti, evaṃ'smī'ti hoti, aññathā'smī'ti hoti, as'asmī'ti hoti, sat'asmī'ti hoti, santi hoti, itthaṃ santi hoti, evaṃ santi hoti, aññathā santi hoti

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
evācāra

adj. of such behaviour; with such conduct [evaṃ + ācāra] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of such behaviour; with such conduct
Construction evaṃ + ācāra
evāyaṃ

sandhi. so this; so like this [eva + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning so this; so like this
Construction eva + ayaṃ
Sanskrit eva + ayam

Examples

anekehi sambhārehi samāraddhā vadati, seyyath'idaṃ, doṇiñ'ca paṭicca cammañ'ca paṭicca daṇḍañ'ca paṭicca upadhāraṇe ca paṭicca tantiyo ca paṭicca koṇañ'ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjaṃ vāyāmaṃ paṭicca ev'āyaṃ, bhante, vīṇā nāma anekasambhārā mahāsambhārā.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

aho vat'āyaṃ samīti yānakāraputto imissā nemiyā imañ'ca vaṅkaṃ imañ'ca jimhaṃ imañ'ca dosaṃ taccheyya, ev'āyaṃ nemi apagatavaṅkā apagatajimhā apagatadosā suddhā assa sāre patiṭṭhitā'ti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ
evāhaṃ

sandhi. so I; thus I [evaṃ + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning so I; thus I
Construction evaṃ + ahaṃ
Antonym nevāhaṃ
Sanskrit eva + aham

Examples

aññāya ca pan'āhaṃ samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtikānaṃ dhammaṃ ev'āhaṃ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto'ti.

AN 3.65 sarabhasuttaṃ

ev'āhaṃ cintayitvāna,
n'ekakoṭisataṃ dhanaṃ,
nāth'ānāthānaṃ datvāna,
himavantam'upāgamiṃ.

BV 2 sumedha patthanā kathā
evetaṃ

sandhi. just this [eva + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning just this
Construction eva + etaṃ
Sanskrit eva + etam

Example

tatr'āp'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, n'eva āgatiṃ vadāmi, na gatiṃ, na ṭhitiṃ, na cutiṃ, na upapattiṃ. appatiṭṭhaṃ, appavattaṃ, anārammaṇam'ev'etaṃ. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ
evesā

sandhi. this is just [eva + esā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron
Meaning this is just
Construction eva + esā
Sanskrit eva + eṣā

Example

yā c'eva kho pana ajjhattikā pathavīdhātu yā ca bāhirā pathavīdhātu, pathavīdhātu'r'ev'esā.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
esa

pron. this; he; it ✓

Grammar pron, masc nom sg of eta
Meaning this; he; it
Antonym nesa
Synonym eso
Sanskrit etaḥ, etam

Examples

na hi verena verāni,
sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ,
averena ca sammanti,
esa dhammo sanantano.

DHP 5 yamakavaggo

yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tadiṅgha brūhi,
kathaṃ nu dhīrā vitaranti oghaṃ,
jātiṃ jaraṃ sokapariddavañ'ca,
taṃ me muni sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
esati

pr. (+acc) seeks; looks (for); probes (for) [√es + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning seeks; looks (for); probes (for)
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Base √es + a > esa
Construction esa + ti
Synonym abhipassati, gavesati, pariyesati
Sanskrit eṣati
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Examples

tassa so bhisakko sallakatto satthena vaṇamukhaṃ parikanteyya. satthena vaṇamukhaṃ parikantitvā esaniyā sallaṃ eseyya.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

ajjhattam'ev'upasame,
na aññato bhikkhu santim'eseyya,
ajjhattaṃ upasantassa,
n'atthi attāṃ kuto nirattāṃ vā.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
esana

adj. (+acc) seeking; searching (for); requesting; begging (for) [√es + ana] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from esati (+acc)
Meaning seeking; searching (for); requesting; begging (for)
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Construction √es + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Synonym pariyesaka
Sanskrit eṣaṇa
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Examples

na munī gāmam'āgamma,
kulesu sahasā care,
ghās'esanaṃ chinnakatho,
na vācaṃ payutaṃ bhaṇe.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

sukhajīvino pure āsuṃ,
bhikkhū gotamasāvakā,
anicchā piṇḍam'esanā,
anicchā sayan'āsanaṃ,
loke aniccataṃ ñatvā,
dukkhass'antaṃ akaṃsu te.

SN 2.25 jantusuttaṃ
esanā 1

fem. searching; seeking; quest [√es + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from esati
Meaning searching; seeking; quest
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Construction √es + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Synonym pariyesanā
Commentary (MNa) esanāpasuto'ti suddhiesan'atthāya pasuto, payutto.
Sanskrit eṣaṇā
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Example

sotatto sosinno c'eva,
eko bhiṃsanake vane,
naggo na c'aggim'āsīno,
esanāpasuto munī'ti.

tosemi sabbapāṇinaṃ.

APA 3 sāriputtattherāpadānaṃ

Meaning seeking; searching (for); requesting; begging (for)

Commentary (SNt) esamānā pariyesantā.
Sanskrit eṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)
esā

pron. she; this [eta + sā] ✓

Grammar pron, fem nom sg of eta
Meaning she; this
Construction eta + sā
Sanskrit eṣā

Examples

appamattikā esā, bhikkhave, parihāni yadidaṃ bhogaparihāni. etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī'ti.

AN 1.78 kalyāṇamittādivaggo

pakati kho esā, kassapa, lokasmiṃ, dukkaraṃ sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
esāna

prp. (+acc) seeking (for); searching (for) [√es + a + āna] ✓

Grammar prp of esati, trans (+acc)
Meaning seeking (for); searching (for)
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Base √es + a > esa
Construction esa + āna
Derivative kita (āna)
Synonym anvesanta, esanta, esamāna, gavesanta, pariyesamāna, maggayamāna
Sanskrit eṣamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Example

sukhakāmāni bhūtāni,
yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati,
attano sukham'esāno,
pecca so na labhate sukhaṃ.

DHP 131 daṇḍavaggo
esānaṃ 1

pron. for these; for them [ima] ✗
esānaṃ 2

pron. of these; their [ima + ānaṃ] ✓

Grammar pron, masc and nt gen pl of ima
Meaning of these; their
Construction ima > esa + ānaṃ
Synonym imesaṃ, imesānaṃ, esaṃ
Sanskrit eṣām

Example

kacci te, āvuso channa, khamanīyaṃ, kacci yāpanīyaṃ, kacci dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti no abhikkamanti, paṭikkamo'sānaṃ paññāyati no abhikkamo'ti?

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
esānisaṃso

sandhi. (+loc) this is the benefit (of); this is the advantage (of) [esa + ānisaṃso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + masc (+loc)
Meaning this is the benefit (of); this is the advantage (of)
Construction esa + ānisaṃso
Sanskrit etaḥ + anuśaṃsa

Example

dhammo have rakkhati dhammacāriṃ,
dhammo suciṇṇo sukham'āvahati.
es'ānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe,
na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī.

TH 195 dhammikattheragāthā
esāhaṃ

sandhi. I; lit. this I [eso + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning I; lit. this I
Construction eso + ahaṃ
Commentary (SNa) es'āhan'ti eso ahaṃ.
Sanskrit etaḥ + aham

Examples

es'āhaṃ, bho ānanda, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca. upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ ānando dhāretu ajja't'agge pāṇ'upetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan'ti.

SN 51.15 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
esi

aor. sought, searched [√es] ✗
esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhita

adj. standing firm as a pillar; standing as immobile as a column; (comm) standing like a muñja stalk [esikā + ṭhāyī + ṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning standing firm as a pillar; standing as immobile as a column; (comm) standing like a muñja stalk
Construction esikā + ṭhāyī + ṭhita
Compound kammadhāraya (esikaṭṭhāyī iva + ṭhita)
Variant īsikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhita
Commentary (MNa) īsikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā'ti muñje īsikā viya ṭhitā. tatr'āyam'adhippāyo, yam'idaṃ jāyatī'ti vuccati, taṃ muñjato īsikā viya vijjamānam'eva nikkhamatī'ti. esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā'ti'pi pāṭho, sunikhāto esikatthambho niccalo tiṭṭhati, evaṃ ṭhitā'ti attho. ubhayen'api tesaṃ vināsābhāvaṃ dīpeti.
Sanskrit iṣika (bsk) + sthāyin + sthita

Example

satt'ime kāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā, te na iñjanti na vipariṇamanti na aññam'aññaṃ byābādhenti n'ālaṃ aññam'aññassa sukhāya vā dukkhāya vā sukhadukkhāya vā.

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
esikā

fem. gate pillar; column ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning gate pillar; column
Sanskrit iṣika (bsk)

Examples

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ukkhittapaligho iti'pi, saṃkiṇṇaparikkho iti'pi, abbūḷh'esiko iti'pi, niraggaḷo iti'pi, ariyo pannaddhajo pannabhāro visaṃyutto iti'pi.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

satt'ime kāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā, te na iñjanti na vipariṇamanti na aññam'aññaṃ byābādhenti n'ālaṃ aññam'aññassa sukhāya vā dukkhāya vā sukhadukkhāya vā.

MN 76 sandakasuttaṃ
esikātthambha

masc. strong post before a city gate ✗
esita

pp. sought, searched [√es] ✗
esitabba

ptp. should be sought after [√es] ✗
esitvā

abs. (+acc) having sought; having looked (for); having probed (for) [√es + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of esati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having sought; having looked (for); having probed (for)
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Construction √es + itvā
Synonym samannesitvā
Sanskrit iṣitvā
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Example

satthena vaṇamukhaṃ parikantitvā esaniyā sallaṃ eseyya. esaniyā sallaṃ esitvā sallaṃ abbuheyya, apaneyya visadosaṃ saupādisesaṃ.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
esinī

adj. (woman) who is seeking; looking for [√es + ī + inī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, fem nom sg of esī
Meaning (woman) who is seeking; looking for
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Construction √es + ī + inī
esī + inī
Synonym esī
Sanskrit eṣiṇī
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Example

yadā balākā sucipaṇḍaracchadā,
kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā,
palehiti ālayam'ālay'esinī,
tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.

TH 196 sappakattheragāthā
esī

adj. who is seeking; looking for [√es + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from esati
Meaning who is seeking; looking for
Root Family √es
Root √es･1 a (seek, search)
Construction √es + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Synonym esinī
Sanskrit eṣin
Sanskrit Root √iṣ 1, 4, 6, 9 (seek, desire)

Examples

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhav'esīnaṃ vā anuggahāya. katame cattāro?

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

yutto kathāyaṃ parisāya majjhe,
pasaṃsam'icchaṃ vinighāti hoti,
apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti,
nindāya so kuppati randham'esī.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
esukārī

masc. name of a Brahman ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a Brahman
esukārīsutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 96 (MN96) ✗
esūpamā

sandhi. (+dat) this (is a) simile (for); this (is an) example (of) [esā + upamā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + fem (+dat)
Meaning this (is a) simile (for); this (is an) example (of)
Construction esā + upamā
Sanskrit etā + upamā

Example

es'ūpamā dāmali brāhmaṇassa,
khīṇ'āsavassa nipakassa jhāyino,
pappuyya jātimaraṇassa antaṃ,
n'āyūhatī pāragato hi so'ti.

SN 2.5 dāmalisuttaṃ
eseva

sandhi. just this; exactly the same [eso + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning just this; exactly the same
Construction eso + eva
Variant esova
Sanskrit etad + eva

Examples

es'eva maggo n'atth'añño,
dassanassa visuddhiyā,
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha,
mārass'etaṃ pamohanaṃ.

DHP 274 maggavaggo

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, sat'ānusāri viññāṇaṃ ahosi, es'eva maggo bodhāyā'ti

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
esevanto

sandhi. (+gen) just this is the end (of) [eso + eva + anto] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + masc (+gen)
Meaning just this is the end (of)
Construction eso + eva + anto
Commentary (MNa) es'ev'anto'ti ayaṃ abhinandan'ādīnaṃ n'atthibhāvo'va rāg'ānusay'ādīnaṃ anto.
Sanskrit etad + eva + antaḥ

Examples

tatr'āp'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, n'eva āgatiṃ vadāmi, na gatiṃ, na ṭhitiṃ, na cutiṃ, na upapattiṃ. appatiṭṭhaṃ, appavattaṃ, anārammaṇam'ev'etaṃ. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.

UD 71 paṭhamanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttasuttaṃ

es'ev'anto rāg'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto paṭigh'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto diṭṭh'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto vicikicch'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto mān'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto bhavarāg'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto avijj'ānusayānaṃ, es'ev'anto daṇḍ'ādāna-satth'ādāna-kalaha-viggaha-vivāda-tuvaṃtuvaṃ-pesuñña-musāvādānaṃ

MN 18 madhupiṇḍikasuttaṃ
eso

pron. this; this person; he [esa + o] ✓

Grammar pron, masc nom sg of eta
Meaning this; this person; he
Construction esa + o
Synonym esa
Sanskrit etaḥ

Examples

eso dhammo eso vinayo etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ

surāmerayapānañ'ca,
yo naro anuyuñjati,
idh'eva'm'eso lokasmiṃ,
mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.

DHP 247 malavaggo
esohamasmi

sandhi. I am this; this is me [eso + ahaṃ + asmi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron + pr
Meaning I am this; this is me
Construction eso + ahaṃ + asmi
Antonym nesohamasmi
Sanskrit etaḥ + aham + asmi

Examples

etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti.

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

cha'y'imāni, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṭṭhānāni. katamāni cha? idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano ... rūpaṃ etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassati

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
essati

fut. (+acc) will go (to); will come (to); will reach [√i + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of eti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will go (to); will come (to); will reach
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a + ssa > essa (fut)
Construction essa + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit eṣyati
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

ye ca kho samma'd'akkhāte,
dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,
te janā pāram'essanti,
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

DHP 86 paṇḍitavaggo

siñca bhikkhu imaṃ nāvaṃ,
sittā te lahum'essati,
chetvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca,
tato nibbānam'ehisi.

DHP 369 bhikkhuvaggo
ehambho

sandhi. come now!; hey come!; come on! [ehi + ambho] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + ind
Meaning come now!; hey come!; come on!
Construction ehi + ambho
Variant evaṃ bho
Commentary (ANa) ehambho purisā'ti ālapanam'etaṃ.
Sanskrit ehi + ham + bhoḥ

Examples

tam'enaṃ tvaṃ evaṃ vadeyyāsi, eh'ambho purisa, ayaṃ maggo rājagahaṃ gacchati. tena muhuttaṃ gaccha, tena muhuttaṃ gantvā dakkhissasi amukaṃ nāma gāmaṃ

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

eh'ambho purisa, yaṃ jānāsi taṃ vadehī'ti. so ajānaṃ vā āha, jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha, na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha, passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha, na passāmī'ti.

AN 3.28 gūthabhāṇīsuttaṃ
ehāvuso

sandhi. come friend!; come brother! [ehi + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, imp + masc
Meaning come friend!; come brother!
Construction ehi + āvuso
Sanskrit ehi + āyusmanto

Example

yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ, eh'āvuso, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā'ti tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya, gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti

VIN PAT PC 42 uyyojanasikkhāpadaṃ
ehi

imp. come! [√i + a + hi] ✓

Grammar imp 2nd sg of etu, intrans
Meaning come!
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a > e
Construction e + hi
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit ehi
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Examples

atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena theraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantehi, satthā taṃ, āvuso thera, āmantetī'ti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
ehi tvaṃ

idiom. come you! come! ✗
ehiti

fut. (+acc) will come [√i + a + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut of eti, trans (+acc)
Meaning will come
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a + ssa > ehi (fut, irreg)
Construction ehi + ti
Sanskrit eṣyati
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

sammodamānā gacchanti,
jālamādāya pakkhino,
yadā te vivadissanti,
tadā ehinti me vasan'ti.

JA 33 sammodamāna jātakaṃ
ehinti

fut. (+acc) they will come [√i + a + ssa + nti] ✓

Grammar fut 3rd pl of ehiti, trans (+acc)
Meaning they will come
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a + ssa > ehi (fut, irreg)
Construction ehi + nti
Sanskrit eṣyanti
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

sammodamānā gacchanti,
jālamādāya pakkhino,
yadā te vivadissanti,
tadā ehinti me vasan'ti.

JA 33 sammodamāna jātakaṃ
ehipassika

adj. open to inspection; inviting to come and see for oneself; verifiable; lit. come! see! [ehi + passa + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from ehipassa
Meaning open to inspection; inviting to come and see for oneself; verifiable; lit. come! see!
Construction ehi + passa + ika
ehipassa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Commentary (SNa) yo ettha ariyamaggadhammo, so attano pavattisamanantaram'eva phalaṃ detī'ti attho. ehi passa imaṃ dhamman'ti evaṃ pavattaṃ ehipassavidhiṃ arahatī'ti ehipassiko
Sanskrit ehi + paśya + ka

Examples

dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī'ti

DN 16.11 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

so navañ'ca kammaṃ na karoti, purāṇañ'ca kammaṃ phussa phussa byantīkaroti, sandiṭṭhikā nijjarā akālikā ehipassikā opaneyyikā paccattaṃ veditabbā viññūhi.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
ehibhadantika

adj. (one) who accepts an invitation (to take alms) ✗
ehibhaddantika

adj. who comes when asked; lit. come sir [ehi + baddanta + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who comes when asked; lit. come sir
Construction ehi + baddanta + ika
ehibhaddanta + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Antonym naehibhaddantika
Commentary (MNa) bhikkhāgahaṇ'atthaṃ ehi bhaddante'ti vutto na etī'ti na ehibhaddantiko.
Sanskrit ehi + bhadanta

Example

tatrāssu me idaṃ, sāriputta, tapassitāya hoti, acelako homi muttācāro hatth'āpalekhano, na ehibhaddantiko na tiṭṭhabhaddantiko

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
ehibhikkhu

sandhi. (the oldest formula of admission to the Order), come O monk ✗
ehibhikkhunī

fem. one ordained by the formula "come nun!" ✗
ehisāgatavādī

adj. welcoming: saying "come, you are welcome" ✗
ehisi

fut. (+acc) you will go (to); you will come (to) [√i + a + ssa + si] ✓

Grammar fut 2nd sg of ehiti, trans (+acc)
Meaning you will go (to); you will come (to)
Root Family √i
Root √i･1 a (come, go)
Base √i + a + ssa > ehi (fut, irreg)
Construction ehi + si
Sanskrit eṣyasi
Sanskrit Root √i 1, 2 (go)

Example

siñca bhikkhu imaṃ nāvaṃ,
sittā te lahum'essati,
chetvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca,
tato nibbānam'ehisi.

DHP 369 bhikkhuvaggo
ehisvāgatavādī

adj. welcoming: saying "come, you are welcome" ✗
eḷa

masc. sheep ✓

Grammar masc, in comps
Meaning sheep
Notes see eḷā
Sanskrit eḍa

Example

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... kusītā hīnavīriyā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
eḷaka 1.1

masc. goat; ram [eḷa + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from eḷa
Meaning goat; ram
Construction eḷa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit eḍaka

Examples

seyyathā'pi nāma balavā puriso dīghalomikaṃ eḷakaṃ lomesu gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya, evam'ev'āhaṃ samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ vādena vādaṃ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

bhante pubbe dīpino eḷake khādanti ahaṃ pana eḷake dīpino anubandhitvā murumurū'ti khādante addasaṃ

JAa 77 mahāsupinajātakavaṇṇanā
eḷaka 2.1

masc. threshold; doorway ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning threshold; doorway
Commentary (DNa) na eḷakam'antaran'ti ummāraṃ antaraṃ katvā diyyamānaṃ na gaṇhati. kasmā? ayaṃ maṃ nissāya antarakaraṇaṃ labhatī'ti. daṇḍamusalesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit eluka (bsk)

Example

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
eḷakacamma

nt. sheep's skin; goat's skin ✗
eḷakamantaraṃ

ind. inside a doorway; across a threshold [eḷakaṃ + antara + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of eḷakamantara
Meaning inside a doorway; across a threshold
Construction eḷakaṃ + antara + aṃ
eḷakamantara + aṃ
Commentary (DNa) na eḷakam'antaran'ti ummāraṃ antaraṃ katvā diyyamānaṃ na gaṇhati. kasmā? ayaṃ maṃ nissāya antarakaraṇaṃ labhatī'ti. daṇḍamusalesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit eluka (bsk) + antaram

Example

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
eḷakaloma

nt. rams’ wool; goats’ fleece [eḷaka + loma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rams’ wool; goats’ fleece
Construction eḷaka + loma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (eḷakānaṃ + loma)
Sanskrit eḍaka + roma

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 12 suddhakāḷakasikkhāpadaṃ

bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni, paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni asante hārake.

VIN PAT NP 16 eḷakalomasikkhāpadaṃ
eḷakalomadhovāpanasikkhāpada

nt. rule about making wash goats’ fleece; Nissaggiya 17 [eḷakaloma + dhovāpana + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about making wash goats’ fleece; Nissaggiya 17
Construction eḷakaloma + dhovāpana + sikkhāpada
eḷakalomasikkhāpada

nt. rule about goats’ fleece; Nissaggiya 16 [eḷakaloma + sikkhāpada] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning rule about goats’ fleece; Nissaggiya 16
Construction eḷakaloma + sikkhāpada
eḷakalomāni

nt. rams' wool; goats' fleece ✗
eḷakasamāna

adj. like sheep or goats ✗
eḷakasaṃvāsa

masc. living together like sheep ✗
eḷakā

fem. ewe; female goat; nanny-goat ✗
eḷakī

fem. ewe; female goat; nanny-goat ✗
eḷagala

adj. with oozing saliva ✗
eḷagalā

fem. Cassia Tora ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning Cassia Tora
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senna_tora
Sanskrit eḍagaja

Example

k'āyaṃ eḷagalāgumbe,
karoti ahuhāsiyaṃ,
na'y'idha naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā,
tāḷaṃ vā susamāhitaṃ,
anamhikāle sussoṇi,
kiṃ nu jagghasi sobhaṇe.

JA 374 cūḷadhanuggaha jātakaṃ
eḷagalāgumba

masc. thicket of Cassia Tora [eḷagalā + gumba] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thicket of Cassia Tora
Construction eḷagalā + gumba
Compound kammadhāraya (eḷagalā + gumba)
Sanskrit eḍagaja + gulma

Example

k'āyaṃ eḷagalāgumbe,
karoti ahuhāsiyaṃ,
na'y'idha naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā,
tāḷaṃ vā susamāhitaṃ,
anamhikāle sussoṇi,
kiṃ nu jagghasi sobhaṇe.

JA 374 cūḷadhanuggaha jātakaṃ
eḷaṇḍa

masc. castor oil plant; Ricinus communis ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning castor oil plant; Ricinus communis
Synonym eraṇḍaka
Variant eraṇḍa
Commentary (MNa) elaṇḍehī'ti elaṇḍā kira sāladūsanā honti, tasmā evam'āha
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ricinus
Sanskrit eraṇḍa

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre mahantaṃ sālavanaṃ. tañ'c'assa eḷaṇḍehi sañchannaṃ.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
eḷamūga 1.1

adj. stupid as a sheep; lit. dumb as a sheep [eḷa + mūga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning stupid as a sheep; lit. dumb as a sheep
Construction eḷa + mūga
Compound kammadhāraya (eḷa viya mūga)
Antonym aneḷamūga
Commentary (MNa) eḷamūgā'ti elamukhā, kha-kārassa ga-kāro kato. lālamukhā'ti vuttaṃ hoti. duppaññānañ'hi kathentānaṃ lālā mukhato galati, lālā ca elā'ti vuccati.
Notes see eḷamūga 2
Sanskrit eḍamūka (bsk)

Examples

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... kusītā hīnavīriyā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā duppaññā eḷamūgā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, duppaññaeḷamūgasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
eḷamūga 2.1

masc. drooling fool; drivelling idiot; lit. drool dumb [eḷā + mūga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning drooling fool; drivelling idiot; lit. drool dumb
Construction eḷā + mūga
Compound kammadhāraya (eḷā + mūga)
Antonym aneḷamūga
Variant elamūga
Commentary (MNa) eḷamūgā'ti elamukhā, kha-kārassa ga-kāro kato. lālamukhā'ti vuttaṃ hoti. duppaññānañ'hi kathentānaṃ lālā mukhato galati, lālā ca elā'ti vuccati.
Notes see eḷamūga 1
Sanskrit eḍamūka (bsk)

Examples

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... kusītā hīnavīriyā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā duppaññā eḷamūgā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, duppaññaeḷamūgasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
eḷā

fem. spittle; saliva; drool ✓

Grammar fem, in comps
Meaning spittle; saliva; drool
Synonym lālā
Variant elā
Notes see eḷa
Sanskrit lālā

Example

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... kusītā hīnavīriyā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

evaṃvihāriṃ + ca + āvuso
evaṃvihārībahulodha

evaṃvihārī + bahulo + idha
evaṃ + vihārībahulo + idha
evaṃvādinopi

evaṃvādino + api
evaṃvādāhaṃ

evaṃvādī + ahaṃ
evaṃvādīnampi

evaṃvādīnaṃ + api
evaṃvādīpi

evaṃvādī + api
evaṃvādīsupi

evaṃvādīsu + api
evaṅgottoti

evaṅgotto + iti
evaṅgottāti

evaṅgotta + iti
evaṅgottā + iti
evemeva

eva + emi + eva
eva + ime + eva
eva + imā + eva
eva + ime + iva
evābhijānaṃ

eva + abhijānaṃ
evaṃ + abhijānaṃ
evāhaṃ

eva + ahaṃ
evaṃ + ahaṃ
evāyaṃ

eva + ayaṃ
evaṃ + ayaṃ
eḷagalavāco

eḷagala + vāco
eḷakapādakaṃ

eḷaka + pādakaṃ
eḷaka + apādakaṃ
eḷakasaṃvāsaññeva

eḷakasaṃvāsaṃ + eva
eḷamūgoti

eḷamūgo + iti
eṇeyyajaṅghoti

eṇeyyajaṅgho + iti
eṇeyyakampi

eṇeyyaka + api
eṇeyyakaṃ + api
